loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has two children aged 2 and 5. 

In 2010, Isatu established her provision, toiletries, drinks and rice business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and to assist her husband with the upkeep of their home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 453,709 every month from this business. She started the business selling soap and now has added provisions.  

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to pay for additional rice. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit. 

In the future, Isatu plans to expand the rice business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for rice.

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter lives in northern Albania and has five children. All of his children attend public school.

To earn a living, Pjeter sells raw milk and baby calves at the local market. Currently, his animals live in the shack you see in the background of the photo.

Pjeter explains that his region is known for bitter cold weather and snowy winters. Last year, one of his grown-up calves died from the cold, and it was very upsetting to him because he could not prevent it from happening. Right away, he put a stove into the shack, which is why you can see a pipe sticking out of the pictured shack, and burned wood to warm up his animals. Even with the stove, however, he was very sad to awake one morning to find that his calf was no longer alive.

As a result, he no longer wishes to have his animals sleep and live in such harsh conditions. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to build a stable for his animals.

loans.use: to improve his animals' living conditions by building a stable

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 48 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos desde hace 12 años. Se gana la vida como albañil  desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como junto a su esposa llevan el pan de cada día a su hogar. Con el fin de darle condiciones más seguras a su familia, ha tomado la decisión de mejorar el muro perimetral de su casa ya que se encuentra deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita a FUSAI este crédito para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, ladrillo, y cemento para reparar el muro de su casa y  además con el mismo material mejorará el techo de la cocina de su casa ya que la lámina esta picada y el agua se filtra; se ahorrará el pago de la mano de obra ya que él mismo realizará las obras.
texts.en: Manuel, 48 years old, has lived in his own home with his wife and children for 12 years. He has been working as a mason for a long time, and that is how he helps his wife support their family. Hoping to make his family's lives safer, he has decided to improve the perimeter wall of their house, which is deteriorating. He is therefore requesting this loan from FUSAI, which he will use to buy galvanized sheet metal, bricks, and cement to repair the wall. He will also improve the roof of their kitchen, as the current roof is damaged and leaky. He will save money on labor costs by doing the work himself.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, bricks, and cement to repair the wall around his home.

loans.name: Nelson Alexander

texts.es: Nelson de 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto  a  su compañera de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes, pero tiene mucha energía para trabajar y seguir luchando para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Nelson presta servicios de seguridad en una empresa del municipio donde habita y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda así como reparar el corredor de su casa que se encuentra dañado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construcción de cuarto y reparación de corredor.
texts.en: Nelson is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their 8-year-old son. They live in humble conditions, but Nelson has a lot of energy to work hard and keep struggling to improve his family's situation. Nelson works as a security guard at a local company and supports his family that way. He wants to build a bedroom in their home and do repairs in the corridor, which is damaged. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI so he can buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build the room and repair the corridor.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build a bedroom and repair the corridor.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta de 56 años de edad habita en casa propia  junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su madre de 79 años de edad  y sus tres nietos. Tiene 25 años de trabajar como masajista dentro de su comunidad. Muchas personas la prefieren ya que están muy satisfechos con el servicio de masajes que presta. Hace unos meses terminó de construir las paredes de un cuarto el cual ahora desea ponerle el techo y el piso para poder habitarlo. Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, grava y pagar la mano de obra necesaria que le permitan terminar el cuarto de su casa.
texts.en: Berta, 56 years old, lives in her own home with her 79-year-old mother and her three grandchildren. She has been working as a massage therapist in her community for 25 years. Many people prefer her services because they are very satisfied with the massages she gives. A few months ago she erected the walls for a bedroom in her home, and now she wants to install a roof and floor so it will be habitable. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so she can buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, sand, and gravel and pay for the labor needed to finish the bedroom.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, sand, and gravel and pay for the labor needed to finish building a bedroom.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años de edad. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su localidad. Trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo ya que ella es el único soporte económico para él. Con el fin de tener mayor seguridad para ella y su hijo, ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar e instalar nuevas puertas y ventanas de su casa ya que las actuales están muy deterioradas.
texts.en: Rosa, 44 years old, is unmarried and has one 16-year-old son. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in the local market for eight years. She works very hard to make life better for her son, since she is the only one who takes care of him. For the safety of herself and her son, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase and install new doors and windows in their home, as the current ones are in very bad shape.

loans.use: to purchase and install new doors and windows in her home.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: Timotea tiene 47 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Ella es pequeña comerciante de ropa para dama, caballero y niño. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en el mercado de su localidad. Es muy trabajadora y muchas personas dan buenas referencias de ella como una mujer responsable y emprendedora.  Su casa es muy sencilla pero propia y actualmente el techo se encuentra dañado  y es necesario que se repare. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la comprar de lámina galvanizada y reparar el techo además comprar cemento y arena para encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y no es muy saludable para su familia.
texts.en: Timotea, 47 years old, lives in very humble conditions with her husband and their 16-year-old son. She has a small business selling clothing for men, women, and children. She sells her goods in the local market. She works very hard, and many people speak highly of her as a responsible, enterprising woman. Her house is quite basic, but it is hers. At the moment the roof is damaged and needs to be repaired. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI so she can buy galvanized sheet metal and repair the roof. She will also buy cement and sand to install a cement floor, as the home's dirt floor is not hygienic for her family.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, and sand to repair the roof and install a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, se está preparando para surtir sus productos, ella invertirá en la compra de lociones, cremas corporales, cosméticos, que sus clientes le demandan. Para Sandra la inversión anterior le ayudo a aumentar el número de clientes,  a mejorar los ingresos, pagar sus cuotas y así salir de sus deudas.
Con su economía mejorada ha logrado ampliar su casa, se encuentra saludable, y muy positiva en seguir trabajando para que su negocio se mantenga a la vanguardia.
texts.en: Sandra is getting ready to restock her products. She will buy lotions, body creams, and cosmetics to meet her customers' needs. Sandra's previous loan helped her increase her customer base, increase her income, and pay off her debts. Thanks to her improved financial situation, she has been able to expand her house, and she is in good health and feeling optimistic about working to keep her business vibrant.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a 31-year-old married man. He and his wife have one child, and they live in Mombasa, Kenya.

For the last eight years, he has been buying and selling green maize to earn a living. He explains that the business has really grown in recent years.

He learned about Milango through friends, and he decided to join so that he could access credit for his business and ultimately save more for his family's living expenses. He is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of green maize for re-sale purposes. He hopes that his business will expand from a retail business to a wholesale business in the next five years despite the usual challenges, such as competition. He plans on using the extra income he expects to generate from his business as a result of the loan to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of green maize for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is married with one child. He has been a maize farmer for the past eight years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming in his business so that he can acquire machines and tractors in the future that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married, with four children, all of whom go to school.She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She sells "makuti" (thatching materials made from palm leaves), and she has been in this business for five years.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.She also operates a food stall business.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase more makuti for resale.  She expects to do this without any difficulties, and to continue working without any problems

loans.use: to purchase more "makuti" for resale

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una, y así ir trabajando. Cada una está dando lo mejor de sí para mejorar, capacitarse e ir creciendo.
Juana es parte de este grupo, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su propia casa, y cuenta también que al principio fue un poco duro empezar, pero que gracias a su arduo trabajo, a la ayuda de su familia y a las capacitaciones que recibe ha ido mejorando. Ella quiere seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia, es por eso que sigue esforzándose.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su negocio con productos variados, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, frutas y demás. Agradecen también por esta oportunidad que tienen.
texts.en:
This group is completing the poverty elimination survey to better understand each members' situation and then get to working. Each member is giving their all in order to improve themselves, train, and continue growing. 

Juana is a member of this group who manages a small grocery store out of her own home. She remembers how it was a little hard to get started in the beginning, but that thanks to her hard work, the help of her family, and the training she has received things have improved. She hopes to continue growing and helping her family. That's why she keeps putting for the effort. 

She is requesting this loan in order to stock her business with a variety of products such as foodstuffs, beverages, dairy products, fruits, and other items. The group is also grateful for the opportunities that they have.

loans.use: purchase foodstuffs, beverages, dairy products, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Andrés Alexander

texts.es:
Andrés de 24 años, estudio hasta noveno grado, por diversas circunstancias de la vida no continua estudiando. Él solamente está acompañado y su compañera de vida trabaja en una casa desempeñando los oficios domésticos. Ellos solo tienen una hija de 2 años de edad que vive junto a ellos, en su vivienda también viven sus padres y 3 hermanos mas pero ellos no dependen de él, las personas que dependen del solo es su esposa y su hija. 

Andrés se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas, como soldador, tiene 6 años de trabajar, sus hermanos mayores desempeñaban la misma actividad y por eso él aprendió el oficio de soldador; como vio que era una actividad que generaba buenos ingresos económicos. Por eso decidió, dedicarse a soldar, aparte de ser soldador en los tiempos libres también se dedica a cultivar la tierra en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos). 

Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad solo estudiaba y a la agricultura. Andrés, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que tomar 2 buses a una distancia aproximadamente de 8 kilómetros, en la actividad que desempeña, un hermano más realiza el oficio de soldar y es horario es estable de 7 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.   

El préstamo lo utilizara para la remodelación de su casa, construirá una habitación,  para estar más cómodo con su familia, comprara 300 bloques, un metro de arena y 5 bolsas de cementó esto les permitirá vivir más cómodamente con su esposa y su hija, este proyecto ha sido un deseo que han tenido desde hace tiempo, de tener su propia habitación para su familia. 


Para el futuro Andrés, desea tener su propia casita para vivir con su esposa y su hija, tener un mejor empleo para mejorar sus ingresos. Él espera para su hija, que sea una persona de bien que pueda terminar sus estudios hasta una carrera universitaria y con el apoyo del crédito, le permitirá generarle una oportunidad de superación con este crédito y futuros.
texts.en:
Andres is 24 years old and has a ninth grade education.  He was not able to continue due to many life’s circumstances.  He is married and has a two year old daughter who lives with them.  His wife works as s housekeeper.  His parents and three siblings also live with them but they are not dependent on him.  Only his wife and daughter are dependent.

Andres works as a welder on metal structures and has been doing so for six years.  His older brothers also work the same trade and this is how he learned to weld.  He saw that this generated good income, so he decided to become a welder.  Aside from that, he also works as a farmer (raising basic grains) in his spare time.  Before doing this, he was just a farmer.

Andres takes two busses for a distance of 8 km to get to his place of work, where he and one of his brothers weld.  It’s a stable schedule from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm.

He will use the money from this loan to remodel his home so that his family will be more comfortable.  He will buy 300 cinder blocks, a cubic meter of sand, and five bags of cement.  This will allow him and his wife and daughter to live more comfortably.  They have wanted to do this for some time and have a house for his family.

Andres wants a home of his own so he can live with his wife and daughter, and have a better job so that he can improve his income.   He wants his daughter to become a person of means with a university education and this and future loans will help generate an opportunity for success.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, a sus 49 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante 12 años trabajó como empleado en una empresa, pero después de tantos años no había adquirido nada y se sentía estancado, pues el salario que recibía sólo le alcanzaba para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Por esta razón decidió retirarse de la empresa y aventurarse a trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía y medias de manera ambulante, en un pequeño puesto que las autoridades de espacio público le otorgaron en el centro de la ciudad, allí atiende todos los días de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm y gracias al empeño, la perseverancia y a la dedicación con la que ha trabajado, logró adquirir 2 casas y le ha brindado educación a sus hijos, durante los 10 años que lleva en funcionamiento. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (medias), y así abastecerse para la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, época en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Francisco sueña con fortalecer aún más su negocio y en un futuro tener la posibilidad de montar su negocio en un almacén más grande, que sea rentable y le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Francisco is 49 years old, has three children, and is in a common law marriage.  He worked as an employee for 12 years but after so many years he did not advance and he felt stuck because his salary was not enough to meet the basic needs of his household.  So he decided to leave the company and try his luck at working as an independent merchant selling different merchandise and socks on foot in a public space in the city center.  He works there every day from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm and he was able to buy two houses, and provide an education for his children, thanks to the dedication, and perseverance he has put into his work over the past ten years.  He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise in quantity (socks) to stock up for the approaching Christmas season, when his sales and income increase.  Francisco wants to strengthen his business and in the future be able to start a larger store that will be more profitable and will allow him to have stable finances so he can provide is family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (socks).

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking and enterprising woman.She has operated a fish selling business for the last two years, selling at the market to her neighbors’ and passersby.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Apart from her fish selling business, Agnes also sells makuti (a roof thatch made from palm leaves). With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join and to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Khazangul

texts.en: Khazangul, 44, is married and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two infant grandchildren in the village of Kirachmughanlo. Khazangul’s husband is a welder and works from his house on special projects. The family runs an agricultural business and grows tomatoes as well as cucumbers to sell. Besides these, they breed livestock and sell meat seasonally. In order to generate more income, Khazangul decided to start up a grocery store in front of her house but found she didn’t have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Khazangul was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required business experience as a precondition for a loan. But Khazangul has now received her loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to a country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products. With a loan of 4,000 USD,  Khazangul will purchase stocks of basic groceries to start a store. She will work as a salesperson herself and generate income. She hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of basic groceries for starting up a store in her village.

loans.name: Menik

texts.en: Menik is a private entrepreneur from Norabats village of Ararat region. He lives with his parents and brother. Menik runs a store in Yerevan, where he sells different meat products. With the help of his family members, he also produces and sells half-stuff meat products, such as chicken cutlets and meat dumplings. To be able to run his small business in a more efficient and sustainable way, Menik needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase refrigerators for his store to keep the meat products. As this is Menik’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products, because they have no credit history. Menik and his family will be very thankful to lenders for their goodwill in helping them collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their small business.

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators for his store in order to keep meat products

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en: Nikoloz is a 51-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, two sons and daughter-in-law in a small village in the Zestaponi district. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in poverty.  According to above mentioned situation, Nikoloz lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions in order to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $3000 USD and open a grocery store. He will purchase a stock of groceries. Nikoloz thinks that this business will be profitable, as it is in great location and will be the only business of this kind in the area. After the grocery store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover their everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  With support from the Start Up program Nikoloz will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a grocery store

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagros está en su 1er ciclo, empezando a trabajar dentro del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas vienen mejorando sus vidas.
Alguien digno de destacar es la Sra. Idalina, quien es lavandera, y comenta que lava prendas ajenas, además de ser un trabajo muy sacrificado por medio de esto da a su familia para el gasto cotidiano y asi por medio de su esfuerzo quiere ir mejorando y saliendo de su pobreza.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de suavizantes, jabones, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo, y dice que conforme pasa el tiempo quiere ir ampliando su negocio y dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
The Milagros [Miracles] Group is in its first cycle in the Poverty Stoplight program, where everyone works and helps one another in order to get ahead.  They are trying to eliminate poverty; thanks to their work, they are all improving their lives.  

The highlighted member is Idalina.  She is a washer-woman and says that she washes other people's clothing.  It is a job that requires a lot of sacrifice.  Through this work, she is able to cover daily expenses.  Through her efforts and determination, she wants to continue improving and lifting herself out of poverty.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric softener, soap, and other supplies that would allow her to continue working.  She says that as time passes, she wants to continue growing her business so that she can offer jobs to other people.

loans.use: to buy fabric softener, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is age 28. He would like to use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en:
Arkadi is from the  Dalarik village in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents, his wife, his five-year-old daughter, and his three-year-old son. Arkadi works in a taxi service as a taxi driver, and his father works in the private sector. They are the main breadwinners of the family. Their salaries alone, however, are not enough to fully meet the needs of the family. 

Arkadi is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows and pigs and in cultivation of alfalfa, apricots, and grapes. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. Arkadi sells the agricultural products in the local market. To be able to run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, he currently needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase three steers, two pigs, and some forage for the livestock.

Expanding the livestock with the help of the loan will help Arkadi maintain and develop his agribusiness. Arkadi and his big family will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three steers, two pigs, and  some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a male Ugandan, aged 35 years and married to Agatha. They have children and three of them attend school. He is a farmer who grows mainly rice, maize, and beans on a large scale. He had acquired a loan of 1,500,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from UGAFODE to purchase a motorcycle which he got and repaid well.

Lawrence has again approached UGAFODE for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX to buy cement, iron sheets, sand, and timber so that he can complete his residential house since the one he is currently residing in is in a poor state.

He hopes to pay back using the collections from motorcycle riding and the sale of his agricultural products. He dreams of completing his residential house. His main challenges are the weather changes which affect his agricultural production and the poor state of roads which affect his transport business. However he is honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su tercer ciclo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron por sus familias, para poder darles un futuro mejor al que ellas tuvieron. Una de ellas es 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona quien se dedica en la venta de lentes para vista de Vision Spring que forma parte de las microfranquicias ofrecidas por la fundación, como modelo de ideas de negocios, y así por medio de esto y sumado a las capacitaciones es que ella está saliendo adelante y luchando.
La Sra. Ramona  Solicita de este crédito para la comprar microfranquicias de lentes, lo que le ayudará  a mejorar su nivel de pobreza generando mayor ganancias, y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This group is in their third loan cycle.  The women in the group are female heads of household who joined in order to give their families a better future than what they had.  

One of the members is Ramona, who works selling Vision Spring eyeglasses, which forms part of the micro-franchises offered by the foundation as a model of business ideas.  With this work and the trainings she has received, she is moving forward and fighting to succeed.

Ramona is requesting this loan to purchase micro-franchises to sell eyeglasses, which will help her improve her level of poverty by generating more income and continuing to work.

loans.use: to purchase micro-franchises to sell eyeglasses.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 34 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizers for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Mujeres Con Valor Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está iniciando en el programa de comités, tienen sus esperanzas puestas en poder ir mejorando y creciendo en el emprendimiento de cada una de ellas, quieren también poder ayudar a sus familias uniendo esfuerzos y trabajo.
Una integrante es la Sra. Faustina quien tiene vendas de helados, y cuenta que casi en la totalidad del año se dedica a esta venta, ya que Paraguay es muy cálido en cuanto al clima. Ella quiere seguir creciendo en su trabajo y es por eso que pide de este crédito, ya que quiere comprar helados de varios sabores, ya que está entrando la temporada de verano y quiere estar bien surtida.
Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben, que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is starting with the committee program.  Their goals are for each of them to be able to improve and grow their understanding.  They also want to be able to help their families join effort and work.

One of the group members is Faustina, who works selling ice cream.  She has been doing this work for a year, since Paraguay has a very warm climate.  She wants to continue growing with her work, so she has requested this loan since she wants to purchase ice creams of different flavors.  Summer time is coming and she wants to be well stocked.

The group is grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, which will help them a lot.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Bonifrinde

texts.en:
Bonifrinde is 49 years old. She is married with eight children. She would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, Bonifrinde wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is an experienced agronomist from Sarnaghbyur village of Shirak region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two-year-old grandson. She works in the local pre-school institution as an educator. With the help of her family members,Hasmik is engaged in breeding livestock such as cows, sheep, pigs, and hens as well as cultivation of wheat and potatoes. The family sells these agricultural products in their local market. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. As autumn is progressing, Hasmik needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to develop in a sustainable way. She needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase forage for her livestock and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery. Hasmik and her family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be very thankful for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for livestock and to buy fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Dani

texts.en: Dani wants to thank lenders who helped him to buy construction materials to finish a house. With this loan, he was able to have more space in his house. He is still working as a butcher. He said that without the loan, he would not have been able to finish work on the home with just his salary as a butcher. He is very grateful for the opportunity and is now requesting a loan once again so that he can isolate his house and finish the roof, making the additional space more liveable. He is hoping to be able to give his children better living conditions and eventually, a better education. Again, he wants to thank all of the lenders for supporting him with this second loan!

loans.use: to isolate his house and finish the roof

loans.name: Snezana

texts.en: Snezana is a 31-year-old married housewife, living in a minority community in Kosovo with her husband and 3 children between the ages 5 years and 12 years old. Even though her husband works for an electrical company, he makes a very low salary which is only enough to support their family on a daily basis and provide for their basic needs. However, her home is in urgent need of a facade for a long time now which has not been done due to their lack of funds. Snezana is requesting a loan to purchase the building materials to construct the house facade and to close in the balcony for winter time. Snezana said that without this support, she would not be able to facade her house.This loan will help her family to have better living conditions. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for improving their family living conditions and standard of living!

loans.use: to purchase building materials for house facade as well as to close in the balcony for winter time

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
Damien is aged 27 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the maize production. With profits from his farming, Damien wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en: Manuk is an experienced farmer from the Mrgashat village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife and son. Manuk and his wife work in the village secondary school, and his son works in the village self-governance body. All the family works hard to be able to meet their needs. Manuk and his family members are also engaged in breeding pig and hens, as well as cultivating beans, potatoes, cucumbers and grapes. They sell these agricultural products in their local market.  Agribusiness is an important source of income for the family.  To be able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Manuk needs a loan of USD 3000 to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, forage for their livestock as well as to buy chicken nests. Manuk and his family members will be very grateful to all lenders for their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, forage for livestock as well as to buy chicken nests

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza II; está en su ciclo número  2  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, quieren poder ayudar a sus familias. Una de ellas es Adriana quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa ella se encuentra mejorando su situación. Ella se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina, y por medio de esto tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ollas, cacerolas, platos, cubiertos entre otras cosas; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza II" group is in its second cycle of the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They want to be able to help their families. One of the members is Adriana who, through her effort, continuous hard work and applying the necessary attitudes of a successful woman, she is improving her situation. She makes a living selling kitchen utensils, by which she has the earnings to help her family. 

Adriana is requesting this loan to buy pots, casserole dishes, plates, lids and other products, which will help her to solidify her business plan. This will help her continue to improve her earnings. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving, because this will allow her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like pots, casserole dishes, plates, and lids.

loans.name: Virgen Milagrosa Group

texts.es: Este grupo está hecho por tres socias comerciantes exitosas una de ellas es Maritza mujer de 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañero, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de granos básicos como es quintal de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, bidón de aceite, cajas de jabón, de café, bolsón de papel higiénico, etc. Damaris mujer de 25 años su negocio es la venta de fresco, tajada con queso, vigoron  y  Jenny mujer de 24 años su negocio es la venta de comida y frescos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful trade partners.  One of them is Maritza, 33, who lives with her partner.  She has been running a convenience store from her house since five years ago.  She is asking for a loan to buy dry beans and grains, such as a quintal of rice (about 100 lbs), frijoles, sugar, cartons of oil, boxes of soap, coffee, big bags of toilet paper, etc.  
The rest of the group is made up by Damaris, 25, who sells soft drinks, fried plantains with cheese, and pork rinds; and Jenny, 24, who sells food and fresh groceries.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as a quintal (about 100 lbs) of rice, sugar, beans, cartons of oil, boxes of soap, coffee, bags of toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Romen

texts.en:
Romen is a farmer from Mrgashat village of Armavir region. His family consists of his wife, his 17-year-old and 14-year-old sons, his brother, his brother's wife, and his brother's 17-year-old daughter and 14-year-old son. 

To be able to take care of his family, Romen seasonally migrates to Russia as a migrant laborer. His brother is also a migrant worker in Russia. They work hard to be able to meet the growing needs of their family. With the help of his family members, Romen is engaged in breeding livestock of cows, piglets, and hens, and in cultivation of greens and grapes. To be able to sustain the agribusiness, Romen currently wants to increase the livestock. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him reach his goal, enabling him to purchase two cows, two steers, and some forage for the livestock. 

As this is Romen’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Romen and his big family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, two steers, and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Alejandrina Dora

texts.es:
Alejandrina es una mujer de 52 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus hijos y nietos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Alejandrina no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Alejandrina trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Alejandrina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir las paredes de la parte trasera de su hogar con materiales resistentes y adecuados, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 52, lives in the city of Ica, Parcona District, with her children and grandchildren.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Alejandrina was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative she works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in her city.  She works every day for about 8 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Alejandrina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to do home improvements for she wants to build walls in the rear of her house with resistant, adequate materials.  She will thus continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to have a business of her own.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es:
Pedro, casado, padres responsables con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Originario de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo tanto lucha día a día  para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulperia una pequena tienda que vende productos comestibles como  arroz, frijoles, azucar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, margarina, cuajadas, jugos, gaseosas. lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación al cual dedica unas 12 horas diaria ofreciendo sus productos.El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Pedro agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a persona de escasos recursos y países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro is a married father with children in his care.  He’s from Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern part of the country.  He’s noted for being hardworking, responsible with a strong self-improvement drive.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources he was unable to study a professional career and had to start working at a young age to help cover household expenses.  He strives daily to provide a better future for his children.

Thanks to his efforts and desire to get ahead, his economic activity is a ‘pulpería,’ a small store selling food items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, margarine, curd, juice and soft-drinks.  It’s located at home and he spends about 12 hours daily selling his goods.

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital so that in the not too distant future his income will improve.  Pedro is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó su actividad hace 10 años y la escogió porque se lo recomendó un amigo porque ella necesitaba aumentar sus ingresos.  Trabaja con su hijo desde las 10 am hasta las 6 pm.  Es separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos, un barón y una mujer, quien padece de una condición física. Ambos están estudiando en la escuela fiscal de su localidad.  Aspira a futuro poder montar su propio local de venta y servicios celulares en su domicilio, para dedicarse únicamente a esto y dejar de laborar en la empresa donde está ahora.  Por el momento, necesita el crédito para la compra de equipos celulares.
texts.en: This client is from Guayaquil’s Isla sector.  She started her activity ten years ago and chose it thanks to a friend’s recommendation for she needed to increase her income.  She works with her son from 10am until 6pm.  She’s separated from her husband and has two children, a boy and a girl who has a physical condition.  Both are attending the local public school.  She hopes in future to be able to open her own mobile phone store and repair shop at home to do this full-time and stop working for the firm she’s employed at now.  For the moment, she needs the loan to buy mobile phones.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
María Valentina  es una joven  muy trabajadora  y emprendedora de 23 años de edad, casada, y madre de  2 hijos menores de edad.  Ella tiene un grado de educación  primaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero de sus padres a pesar de las limitaciones  y carencias que ellos tenían.
María Valentina desde  hace 4 años  se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo específicamente al cultivo de papa ellos cuentan con su propio terreno  ya que los padres de su esposo se lo heredaron por lo que ella todas las mañanas junto a su esposo camina 20 minutos para llegar a  su lugar de trabajo donde juntos se esfuerzan para cuidar y limpiar su cultivo y poder obtener una excelente  cosecha.
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar  financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a su cultivo de papa como ser  compra de abono,  fungicida,  urea entre otros.
 Ella sueña en un futuro poder comprar más tierra en la cual pueda sembrar y cultivar una mayor cantidad de  papa y de esta forma poder generar mayores ingresos que le permitan brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos como también fortalecer el patrimonio de ellos.
texts.en:
María Valentina, 23, is a very hard working young married woman mother of two minor children.  She completed primary school thanks to her parents'  moral and financial support despite the limitations and lacks they had.

María Valentina has been working in agriculture alongside her husband four years specifically growing potatoes.  They own land that her husband’s parents passed down to them.  She and her husband walk 20 minutes daily to reach their land where together they strive to care for and weed the crop in order to obtain excellent yields.

This is why she needs at present to request financing to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fungicide, urea and others to provide technical assistance to her potato crop.

She dreams in future to be able to buy more land to grow larger amounts of potatoes and generate higher income that will allow her to provide better education for her children and to increase their estate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her potato crop.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra. María, viuda con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su pequeño hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa  nueva como pantalones, blusas, vestidos, toallas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, short. Ropa de niños. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María’s a widow with a minor son; she’s from León, a place located in the west of the country.  She’s noted for being hardworking, responsible with a strong self-improvement drive.  She likes to spend her free time enjoying her little boy.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she needed to start working at a young age to help with household expenses she was unable to attend university.

Thanks to her effort and wish to get ahead, her economic activity is selling new clothes like pants, blouses, dresses, towels, bed linens, underwear, shorts and children’s clothes.  She spends about 10 hours daily selling her goods.

The loan will be used for working capital to stock her business so that in the not too distant future she will earn higher income.  María is grateful to Kiva lenders who provide support to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alina Bartolina

texts.es: La Sra. Alina tiene 31 años, casada y  tiene un hijo de la edad de 4 años,  se dedica  a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir desde hace ya 3 años ella confecciona variedad de blusas para mujeres,   su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra en la  zona de Villa Concepción, la Sra. Alina va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que ella tiene pedidos y también  que entrega el producto terminado a distintas ferias donde venden sus productos,   la Sra. Alina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes,  la Sra. Alina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Alina, 31, is married with a four-year-old son.  She’s been working manufacturing clothing for three years; she makes a variety of women’s blouses.  Her workshop is located at home which is in the Villa Concepción neighborhood.  Alina will use this loan to buy fabric at wholesale to make the clothing.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase investment capital because she has pending orders.  She also delivers the finished garments to various street markets where her goods are sold.

The business challenge that Alina faces is to increase income and she will use profits to invest in supplies to make good quality clothes in order to secure more customer orders.  Alina’s a very hardworking woman who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since this is her only source of income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposo y su pequeña hija, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Micaela no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Micaela trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de venta de patos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Micaela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara materiales para la construcción de dos corrales para sus patos, de esta manera tendrá un lugar adecuado donde criarlos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hija convertida en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Micaela, 28, is a woman living with her husband and little girl in the city of Cañete, Imperial District.  She’s very hardworking, enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to work, Micaela was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Micaela works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in her city and she also works raising ducks to sell.  She works every day for about 10 hours and feels she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Micaela is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy building supplies to build two corrals for her ducks thus having an adequate place to care for them.  She will continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to see her daughter become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Joselin Said

texts.es:
Joselin es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos,ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Joselin no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Joselin trabaja como auxiliar en una empresa municipal de su ciudad,adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Joselin se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara materiales para la construcción de corrales para sus cuyes, de esta manera tendrá un lugar adecuado donde criar a sus animalitos, así pues Joselin seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Joselin, 21, is a single woman living with her parents and siblings in the city of Cañete, Imperial District.  She’s very hardworking, enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to work, Joselin has been unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, she works as an aide in a municipal firm in her city and she also raises guinea pigs.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Joselin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will buy building supplies to build corrals for the guinea pigs in order to have an adequate place to raise her little critters.  Joselin will continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to study a profession.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Max Ivan

texts.es:
Max es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como empleado en el área de panadería de un centro comercial de su ciudad, con este trabajo puede obtener ingresos y poder apoyar a su madre con algunos gastos del hogar.

Max está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar un horno para su madre ya que con todo lo que ha aprendido en el área de panadería con su madre podrán iniciar su negocio de venta de tortas, así  poder mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Max is a young man with a strong desire to get ahead. This is why he works at a bakery at the mall in his city. 

With this job, he earns an income and is able to help him mother with some household costs. 

Max is thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he can buy an oven for his mother. 

With everything he has learnt at the bakery he can start a business with his mother selling cakes. 

This way he can increase his income and fight for his dream of going to university.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Paruyr

texts.en: Paruyr is from Armavir city in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents. Paruyr works as a driver. He is also engaged in cultivating tomatoes, eggplant, peppers and grapes. Paruyr's father helps him in his everyday activities related to farming. He realizes the agricultural products in the local market. To be able to sustain his agribusiness, Paruyr currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase two pigs, to buy some forage for them, to buy fertilizers and to pay for harvesting services. The loan will be a huge support to this young and hard-working farmer and his family, helping them maintain and develop their agribusiness. The family is very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support

loans.use: to purchase two pigs, forage, and fertilizers and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Azniv

texts.en: Azniv is a farmer from Ditavan village in the Tavush region. She lives with her husband and three school-age children (a daughter and two sons). She and her husband are engaged in breeding cows, sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens, and in cultivating wheat, potatoes, grass and several fruits (plum, pomegranate, fig, blood orange, grapes, apple, pear and walnut). The family realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the only source of income for them. As their needs are growing day by day, Azniv wants to enlarge the number of livestock to be able to meet the expenses of her family more effectively. A loan of 1,500 USD will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase eight calves. As this is Azniv’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family is very thankful to the lenders for the good will and support.

loans.use: to purchase eight calves

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es: Duo las victorias de San Martin La señora Victoria es dueña de dos ventas de zapatería en general para niños y adultos, también tiene venta de sandalias, mochilas y cosméticos en general como cremas, champo, colonias y más.  La fechas de fin de año se aproximan y ella ya debe comprar más zapatos en diferentes estilos y numeraciones para que los clientes empiecen a ver que ella ya tiene a la venta nuevo calzado en colores y calidad.  Por eso nuevamente ella hace la solicitud de un nuevo préstamo a Kiva para poder hacer sus pedidos en los almacenes y no ir a últimas horas a comprar la mercadería, también ya debe empezar a surtir mas los cosméticos para ofrecerle de todo a sus clientes y no quedarles mal,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con su negocio.
texts.en:
St. Martin’s Victories Duo

Victoria owns two shoe shops selling shoes in general for children and adults; she also sells sandals, backpacks and cosmetics in general like creams, shampoo, cologne, etc.  The end of the year is approaching and she must buy more shoes in various styles and sizes so that customers will start to see that she has new colors and quality shoes on sale.

This is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan again so that she can place her orders with suppliers and not wait to the last moment to buy merchandise.  She must also start to stock up on more cosmetics to offer everything to her customers and not disappoint them.  She hopes you will be able to help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
Gerson es un hombre de 53 años,vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Gerson no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Gerson trabaja como agente de seguridad, brindando servicios de seguridad ciudadana, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Gerson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir una habitación para sus hijos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un hospedaje de alquiler de habitaciones.
texts.en:
Gerson, 53, is a man living with his two children in the city of Pucallpa.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Gerson was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Gerson works as a security guard providing security for the citizenry.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Gerson is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will make home improvements since he wants to build a bedroom for his children.  He will continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own an inn.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 36 years old. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Natella

texts.en:
Natella  lives in the town of Yeghegnadzor with her husband, mother-in-law and two school-age children. She bakes cakes and sells them at local markets. Natella is a very hardworking woman and over years of tireless work she developed contracts with some shops who also sell her cakes. 

Natella now needs financial support to purchase an oven and other baking equipment. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Natella, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for an oven and other equipment for baking cakes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, a  Kiva borrower who describes himself as determined, operates a business in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He describes his family challenge to be a lack of sufficient water storage capacity. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. 

Daniel hopes that in the future, he will economically sustain his family. This will be his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Stand Up And Fight Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44-year-old Fadzayi from Mutare. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Fadzayi runs a poultry business producing chickens. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are poor quality feed from suppliers and high competition. Fadzayi has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy more chicks and feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare. In the future Fadzayi plans to have more batches of ready chickens and be in a position to supply big supermarkets in town. Fadzayi is a member of the Stand up and Fight group.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 31 years old. With the loan, she would like to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en:
Arshaluys is a private entrepreneur from Yerevan city. She lives with her mother. To be able to take care of her and her's mother's needs, Arshaluys runs a small boutique of clothing for kids. The latter is the only source of income for them. Currently, the assortment of goods she sells in the shop is not that big, and needs to be updated periodically in order for it to function in a sustainable way and be compatible.

To reach that goal, Arshaluys needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase new clothes for kids to sell in her boutique. The loan will help her greatly to sustain her small business and become more successful.

Arshaluys and her mother will be very thankful to all the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for kids to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced agronomist from Shirakavan village of Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband and three daughters (19, 15 and 11 years old). Anahit's husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant to be able to work there and take care of the family. 

Anahit works hard to be able to earn a living for her family. She is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, sheep, piglets and hens. She realizes the agricultural products in the local market. 

As the autumn is progressing, Anahit needs to make some investments in her agribusiness. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase forage for the livestock, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, and pay for the harvesting services. Anahit and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan and to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, and pay for the harvesting services.

loans.name: Angeles - 22 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento ANGELES – 22 está compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Rosario tiene 35 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 12 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la populosa feria de la  16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Rosario va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la  Sra. Rosario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Rosario es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Ángeles-22” communal bank consists of 8 members; six women and two men.  They carry out a variety of activities and the bank president is Rosario, 35.  She’s married with two children aged 12 and 8 years.  

She works selling second-hand clothes in a stand located in the busy 16 de Julio street market in El Alto.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and she will use it to buy bales of second-hand clothes for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan it the lack of capital.  

The business challenge Rosario faces is competition for there are many other people in this same line of work in the zone.  She will use profits to continue improving her sales stand.  Her wish for her business is to have it well-stocked with merchandise to offer a wide variety of goods to her customers.  Rosario is a hardworking woman who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since this the only activity that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio es un hombre de 35 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica en el distrito de Parcona, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Remigio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Remigio trabaja como chófer de mototaxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Remigio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar y cubrir los gastos de instalación de las puertas de su mototaxi, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Remigio, 35, is single and lives in the city of Ica in the Parcona district. He is a hard enthusiastic worker who puts all his efforts into getting ahead. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because Remigo had to work, he was not able to pursue a professional career. 

On his own initiative, Remigo works as a motorcycle taxi driver providing transportation services in his city. He works every day for approximately ten hours. He believes things are going well for him thanks to his dedication and effort. 

Remigo is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he can buy and cover the costs of installation for doors to his motorcycle taxi. 

This way he can keep working and strive to achieve his goal of owning his own house.

loans.use: to buy and install doors in his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is an experienced farmer from Tolors village of Syunik region. He lives with his wife and elderly mother. Norik and his wife work in the village's secondary school. Their salaries, however, are so low that they cannot afford a living based on those salaries alone. To be able to cover the costs of his family, Norik is engaged in breeding a livestock of sheep and hens and cultivation of wheat, beans, potato, apple and walnut.

Norik's wife assists him greatly in his everyday activities relating to livestock breeding and plant cultivation. Farming is an important source of income for the family. As the autumn is progressing, Norik needs to make some investments in his agribusiness. A loan of USD 1,500 will support him greatly, enabling him to purchase wheat seeds and some forage for the livestock.

Norik and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is married with three children. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Nilton Yuri

texts.es:
Nilton tiene 18 años y trabaja como vigilante en una institución de su ciudad, cada día se esfuerza mucho en sus labores porque es padre de un bebe de 11 meses, al que quiere muchísimo y por ello se esfuerza por salir adelante.

Nilton agradece el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su bebe y poder hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una vida digna a su hijo y poder darle una profesión”.
texts.en:
Nilton, 18, is employed as a watchman in an institution in his city.  He strives much every day because he’s father of an 11-month-old baby he loves very much and the reason why he strives to get ahead.

Nilton’s grateful for the support Kiva lenders are giving him because thanks to it he will be able to buy building supplies to do home improvements and provide better quality of life for his baby and to make his dream reality: to provide his son with a proper life and a profession.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora diversos platos para los clientes que le solicitan como arroz con pollo,saltado,sopas entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria por el centro de la ciudad, la socia a la vez se dedica al lavado de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para su negocio como arroz, aceite, entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de venta de comida, lubricentro, venta de ropa, maestro constructor, trabajadores para empresas privadas.
