loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sophorn, 30, has three children in total. Two of them are still in school. In order to make a living, Sophorn and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for ten years. The current business earns her about 30,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sophal is with Kiva partner VisionFund for this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sophal is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her healthy rice yield in order to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Saphas

texts.en:
Saphas, 43, lives with her husband and five children in a village of Kampong Cham Province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost ten years. 

This is Saphas first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund and she is asking for a loan of 4,000,000KHR in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Tiene 47 años, casad con dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 7 años, ella se dedica  al servicio de atención en distintos acontecimientos sociales como decoración y alquiler de vajilla,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de vajilla, mesas y sillas para  su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de alquiler de vajilla y decoración servicio de mozos  y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 7. She provides a service for various social events, such as decoration, and rental of tableware. 

This is her first loan with the institution. Maria is going to use this loan to buy a variety of tableware, tables and chairs for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. María is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of products; improving her income this way. 

Her wish for her business is to have a store renting tableware and decorations and providing servers; and this way provide a better service to her clientele. She is happy for the opportunity provided, as this is the only work that allows her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy dishes, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Aldren

texts.en:
Aldren is married, with five children, and he resides at Kinuman Sur in Ozamiz City, where he purchases coco shells and charcoal for sale. He has been in this business for ten years to earn for a living. 

He requested a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more coconut shells for charcoal-making to sell in volume in the city. She wants to expand his business and use his returns to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for making charcoal

loans.name: Soklaing

texts.en:
Soklaing, 40, is married with one son residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been growing cassava and supplementing the income by working for others for a fee. Together, they earn about KHR38,000 per day and can save about KHR5,000 each day for their future needs. 

This is the first micro loan for Soklaing with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan of 2,500,000KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland and she will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income in order to make a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sarous' Group

texts.en:
Sarous, 49, is married and she lives in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham Province’s Damabe district, Cambodia. She has four children, all of whom are in school. For the last 12 years, she has been growing cassava and planting cashew nuts. She earns about 97,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sarous has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sarous, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is 54 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Srey Snom district. 

Rice farming is the only main source of her family’s income, and she supplements the income by selling grocery items. The current business earns her about KHR 16,000 per day.

This is the first loan for Ly with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resale. 

She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dúo San Vicente Group

texts.es: Dúo San Vicente Doña Francisca de 53 años de edad, es originaria del Municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, desde hace varios años se dedica al oficio de tejido de servilletas típicas de esta región, doña Francisca vende también los días lunes carnes de res y cerdo de manera ambulante por los al los rededores de su localidad, tiene la vicion y la intensión de seguir trabajando para sus familias, y en estas fechas ya acercándose la época navideña se incrementa la demanda  en los pedidos de servilletas para varias tiendas donde ella entregan, por lo que solicita el credito para la compra de materia prima ( hilos en varios colores).
texts.en:
The San Vicente group is made up of two women. One of them is Sra. Francisca who is 53 years old and a native of the San Juan Sacatepéquez municipality. For several years she has earned her living weaving the napkins that are typical of the region. On Mondays she also sells beef and pork in the streets of the surrounding area.

Francisca has the vision and the commitment to continue working for her family. As Christmas is approaching, the demand for the napkins from the stores where she sells them increases, so she is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as thread in various colours.

loans.use: buy supplies to make napkins to sell

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is 40 years old, single and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Carmela used to sell vegetables. Aside from this, she was engaged in transportation services. In 2009, Carmela joined Kiva partner GDMPC and her previous loan that was used for her garden was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed another loan in order to buy spare parts for the repair of an existing motorcycle . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the repair of an existing motorcycle.

loans.name: Jorge  Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega. De 49 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y accesorios para vehículos. Inicia su negocio hace 3 años con el apoyo de una sobrina que le proporciono productos para que el los comercializara, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro poner su tienda comprando su mercadería al contado.  Solicita el crédito para comprar: espejos, lubricantes, rines, llantas, entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is originally from the city of Chinandega.  He’s 49 years old, married, and the father of two children.  He is a merchant who sells lubricants and vehicle accessories and set up his business for three years, with help from a niece who procured products for them to sell.  With much effort and sacrifice, he was able to set up a store, buying merchandise for cash.  He is asking for this loan to buy mirrors, lubricants, rims, tires, and other things to meet his customers’ needs.  He estimates that this loan will be of great help and that he will be able to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Sreykeo's Group

texts.en:
Sreykeo, aged 29, lives in a rural village of the Srey Snom district.  She has two children, all of whom are dependents on her and still in school. She and her husband are farmers who has been farming rice and raising pigs. Having been in this business for two years, she is able to earn about 13,000KHR per day. 

This is the first micro loan for Sreykeo with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sreykeo is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn more income for her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to use her portion to buy piglets to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Sangke district. All of her children are small and still in school. 

Rice farming is the only main source of her family’s income, and she also works as a paid worker to supplement that income. The current business earns her family a daily income of about KHR 23,000, and she is able to save KHR 8,000 each day. 

This is the third loan for Sophat with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Dúo Luz De Vida Group

texts.es: Duo Luz de Vida, representado por doña Gloria de 64 años, vuida, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, en un local que alquila en el centro de San Lucas Sac, desde hace 3 años, ahora doña Gloria desea también vender zapatos americanos, porque su clientela se lo demanda,por ese motivo esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Calzado y ropa de segunda mano.
texts.en: The Luz de Vida group is represented by 64-year old Sra. Gloria who is a widow. She has been selling American clothing in rented premises in the centre of San Lucas Sac for three years. Now Gloria wants to sell American shoes also because her customers are asking for them. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy secondhand footwear and clothing.

loans.use: buy secondhand footwear and clothing

loans.name: Phay's Group

texts.en:
Phay, who is 39 years old, is married and living with her family in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has two children. 

For the past 10 years, Phay and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of family’s income to make a living. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about KHR 27,000 per day from their current business. 

Phay’s group consists of three members.  She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Phay, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: La Sra. Noemi  tiene 34 años casada con tres hijitos,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la su propio domicilio,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Noemí  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de electrodomésticos que necesita e insumos como abarrotes, aceite y papa,  la Sra. Noemi    enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida pero ella les atiende con mucha amabilidad que hace que sus clientes vayan por ella y el buen sazón que le pone a sus comidas, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Noemi is 34 years old, married, with three small children. She sells food at her food stall located in her own home. This loan is her first with the institution.

She is going to use this loan to purchase home appliances that she needs, and supplies such as groceries, cooking oil and potatoes. Noemi faces challenges in her business such as competition, as there are several people who sell food; but she offers friendly service, so her clients come looking for her and her tasty cooking. 

Her wish for her business is to continue selling meals, and have a restaurant so that she can offer comfort to her clients, be able to make her business grow, improve her income, and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy home appliances and supplies.

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
A married woman who lives in a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Srey Snom province, Ratha is 27 years old and has two children all of whom are still in school. Ratha is a  rice farmer in the local area and she supplements the income by selling grocery items. She earns about 30,00KHR but is able to save about 15,000KHR each day.

Ratha has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Touch, 38, has four children in total. Three of them are in school. Touch and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for ten years to make a living.

Touch is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Touch will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her growth of healthy rice and to better her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador, para poder obtener ingresos y poder llevar un pan a su hogar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de maíz y menestras, Samuel le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Samuel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar más menestras como lentejas, arvejas, pallar, fréjol, entre otros, así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Ser un gran comerciante”.
texts.en:
Samuel is a very hard working man. In order to be able to earn income and support his household, he has a small business selling corn and legumes. Samuel works in his business for around nine hours a day, and believes it is going well because he offers quality products. 

Samuel is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy more legumes such as lentils, peas, lima beans and other beans.  This will enable him to offer a greater variety of products to his customers, to improve his income and to strive to make his dream a reality: "To be a successful merchant."

loans.use: To buy legumes at wholesale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 56-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused. She does farming to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be the lack of rainwater for her harvest. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy iron sheets for roofing her house. They will enable her to harvest rainwater during the rainy season for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in farming. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets

loans.name: Savoern

texts.en:
Savoern, 35, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for ten years and they supplement the family’s income by working as a tailor. She is able to earn about 5US$ per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Savoern has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is requesting another loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting, to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and also to buy a sewing machine to support her tailoring business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Evolution 2.2 Group

texts.en: Patricia is the leader of the group Evolution 2.2, which consists of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Patricia is married with three children, ranging in age from 14 to 25. This is Patricia's third loan cycle with HOPE Congo and will use her portion of the loan to purchase clothes in bulk for her store, which she has been operating for the last six years. One of the challenges that Patricia faces is dealing with the seasonal nature of her business and knowing when certain items will be in demand. In the future, Patricia hopes to continue to grow her activities due to her strong financial aptitude. Additionally, the increased income that she hopes to earn from her business will be put towards a constructing a new home for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her clothing store.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be self reliant. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low business. He will use the KES 13,900 loan to buy cooking gas. His family of six members will be able to cook efficiently. He hopes that in the future, he will own a hard ware store. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cooking gas.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 53-year-old man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 26 years. He describes himself to be aggressive. He does farming to earn a living. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to buy a water pump and water pipes. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water pump for pumping water to irrigate their farm. Irrigation will help them to produce more crops to sell. He hopes that in the future, they will make maximum use of their land and utilize the available water resources to maximum benefits. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen forma parte del grupo de crédito Arco Iris, se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo, el cual le gusta por el compañerismo y la unión existente en el. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador ya que desde su parte más alta se observa gran parte de la ciudad, este lugar es muy turístico, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
La Señora Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que vive es de familiares.
Doña Carmen se dedica a las tareas de su hogar, pero aporta a la economía de su hogar gracias a la crianza de animales como son: pollos, cerdos, cuyes, ganado, también con la agricultura que es más para el consumo de su hogar. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos y alimento para animales. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is part of the Arco Iris [Rainbow] credit group.  She is currently taking her third loan alongside her friends and groupmates. She likes the group because of the companionship and bond that exists in it.  She lives in the vicinity of the Turi parish in Cuenca.  This parish is known as the “Mirador,” or Vantage Point, because from the highest point you can see most of the city; this place is very touristy.  The people work raising animals and farming, and many work in various jobs in the city.

Señora Carmen is 36 years old.  She lives in a common-law relationship and has a 3 year old child.  Her husband works as a construction worker.  The house they live in belongs to relatives.

Doña Carmen works doing the housework, but she also supports her household raising animals such as chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and cattle, and also through her gardening, which is more for her family to eat.

She is going to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of chickens, pigs, and animal feed.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child who is five years old. He describes himself to be determined. He does farming to earn a living. He also runs a taxi business to earn extra income. He describes his family challenge to the lack of water for irrigation causing them to plant late. He will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water pump and pipes to pump water to his farm so that they can irrigate their crops. This will enable them to have sufficient water for irrigation. He hopes that in the future, there will be food security. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He repaid his previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy water pump and pipes

loans.name: Evolution 2.1 Group

texts.en: Jean Maurice is the leader of the group Evolution 2.1, consisting of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. He is married and has a one child who is five years old. Jean Maurice has been with HOPE Congo for three loan cycles and will be using his portion of the loan to purchase more furniture to enhance his store, which he has been operating for the past eleven years. In order to grow his business, Jean Maurice believes that a positive attitude and prayer are keys to having success in the future. His goal is to grow his business and expand into other areas of the city. With this growth, he hopes to invest in a new house for his family and to invest in the education and medical care of his kids.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his shop.

loans.name: Evolution 2.3 Group

texts.en: Claire is the leader of the group Evolution 2.3, which consists of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married with four children who are currently in school. This is Claire's third loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she is going to use her portion of the loan to purchase additional stock of used clothing for her store, which she has been operating for the last 21 years. Claire has noticed that prices in the market have been increasing and that towards the end of each month her sales typically drop due to lower demand. In the future, Claire hopes to overcome these challenges by adding additional locations and to be able to travel to have more direct contact with her suppliers. She is known in her community for being warm and welcoming and dreams one day of improving the housing conditions for her family and sending her children overseas to study at university.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing stock for her store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be very social and friendly. She farms to earn a living. She describes her biggest family challenge to be that they travel long distances to fetch water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water pump and pipes. They will be able to pump water to their home for domestic use. This will benefit six family members. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and pipes.

loans.name: La Vigueur 2.2 Group

texts.en: Emma is one of the members of the group LA VIGUEUR 2.2, which consists of seven micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married with 6 children, ranging in age from 10 to 27. This is Emma's second loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase powdered milk and sugar to make cream, which she sells at her business along with salted fish and other drinks. One of the challenges that Emma faces is very low sales during the dry season (June through August), but she hopes to increase her activities now that the wet season has arrived. She cites saving with HOPE Congo as a critical strategy that will help her overcome her challenges and grow in the future. With increased revenues, Emma will put money towards constructing a new home for her family and financing her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to use for her creamery.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa propia, él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y honesto, desde a hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de un potrillo que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en: Jorge is 45 years old. He lives with his wife in their own house. He is a hard working, responsible and honest man. For many years, he has dedicated his life to breeding cattle in the area in which he lives. He has very good clientele and has earned the trust of his clients. He offers quality and good prices. He has decided to invest in the care of his animals since that is what his business depends on. For this reason, he has requested a loan in order to be able to buy vitamins for his animals and to adjust for the purchase of a colt that will permit him to expand in the business. With this he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue to afford the economic help that his family needs so badly.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and a colt.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es:
José de 40 años,  logro cursar  educación media. Esta acompañado, su señora le ayuda en el negocio(venta de comida). La hija mayor (7 años),  esta estudiando primer grado de educación básica. Con él también viven sus suegros, que de igual forma se involucran en le negocio. 

Él ha instalado una  venta  comida,  se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, su familia siempre se ha dedicado a este tipo de negocio,  el local donde vende, esta a una cuadra de su casa, este es un negocio familiar y  trabajan  toda la semana. 

El dinero lo necesita como capital de inversión , para ofrecer mas productos, ya que este local se encuentra en una zona, donde hay bastante demanda, es un lugar muy transitado por la gente. Su negocio esta frente a la entrada del hospital nacional.

Con esta inversión, su familia obtendrá mayores ingresos, que le servirán para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Sin el crédito se limita a ofrecer  un servicio de poca calidad y muy escasa diversidad de productos , los cuales generan  poca ganancia.

Él desea que con el tiempo, el negocio pueda generar rentabilidad y poder  sustentar a su familia de los ingresos percibidos de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Jose is forty years old, and completed his secondary education. His wife helps with the business by selling food. His oldest daughter (seven years old) is in first grade. His in-laws also live with him, and they are also involved in the business.

He has set up a food shop, and has been dedicated to this for five years. His family has always worked in this type of business. This premises where he sells is a block from his house. This is a family business where they work all week.

José needs the money as a capital investment in order to offer more products. His business is located in an area where there is much demand because people often travel through it. The business is in front of the entrance to the national hospital.

With this investment, his family will obtain a better salary that will improve their living conditions. Without credit, they are limited to offering low quality service and scant diversity of products that generate little revenue.

With time, José would like the business to generate a return and sustain his family with the earnings received from this activity.

loans.use: To purchase more items in order to offer a greater variety of food products.

loans.name: La Vigueur 2.3 Group

texts.en: Rose is one of the members of the group LA VIGUEUR 2.3, which consists of five micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married with 5 children, all of whom are currently in school. This is Rose's third loan cycle with HOPE Congo and she is going to use her portion of the loan to purchase additional stock for her business, which consists of selling plastic materials such as chairs. During the past 15 years of running her business, Rose notes that there is significant variation in her purchasing power due to the fluctuation of exchange rates, since her products are often produced outside of the Congo. In the future, Rose hopes to become a successful businesswoman and be able to send her children to the best schools in the city.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs to sell.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La señora Martha tiene 44 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella y se dedica desde hace15 años a la venta de todo tipo de ropa como faldas, blusas, pantalones etc.
Doña  Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de faldas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, calcetines, etc. y de esta forma tener la mercadería necesaria para continuar con sus ventas y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.
Doña  Martha espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Doña  Martha su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados y  así puedan tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old. She lives in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa, in the center of Honduras. She has two children who depend on her and she has dedicated 15 years to selling many different types of clothing like skirts, blouses, pants, etc.

Martha is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman. She needs a loan to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, tank tops, socks, etc., and thus she will have the required merchandise to continue with sales and to cover her customers orders.
 
Martha hopes that the investment in her business will generate sufficient profits for her to be able to move forward with her family and at the same time she hopes her business will continue growing. 

Martha’s dream is to see her children graduate so that they are able to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To purchase skirts, blouses, dresses, shirts, underwear, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad vive con esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, es un hombre trabajadora y responsable, desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta y crianza de ganado de engorde  en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  así poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: Juan is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in his own house. As a hard working and responsible man, he has dedicated the past 6 years to the sale and care of feed cattle in the area where he lives. He has a strong client base because he has known how to earn the trust of his customers. He offers quality and reasonable prices. He has decided to invest in the care of his cattle since his business depends on that. Because of this, he is asking for a loan to buy vitamins and enriched feed for the cattle so that he can continue to provide a better quality of life, without limitations, for his family.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Sandra Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 35 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, se dedica desde hace11 años a la venta de todo tipo de ropa como faldas, blusas, pantalones etc.
Doña  Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y la mayoría de sus clientes son los vecinos de su colonia, su mama le ayuda con su negocio y también recibe otros ingresos por que vende conos y gas, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de faldas, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, calcetines, etc. y de esta forma tener la mercadería necesaria para continuar con sus ventas y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.
Doña  Sandra espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Doña  Sandra su sueño es en un futuro tener su propia casa.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old and lives in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa in the heart of Honduras. She has worked for 11 years selling all types of clothes, such as skirts, blouses, pants, etc.
 
Sandra is an entrepreneur and a hard working woman, and the majority of her clients are neighbors from her part of the city. Her mother helps with her business, and she also receives other income by selling cones and gas. She needs the loan to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, shirts, socks, etc., and in this way will have the necessary merchandise to continue her sales and meet the needs of her clients.

Sandra hopes that the investment in her business will generate sufficient profits so that she can move forward with her family, and at the same time she hopes that her business continues growing. 

Sandra dreams of having her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, dresses, shirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Sreynich

texts.en:
Residing in the Stoeung Sen District of Kampong Thom Province, Sreynich is 19 years old and single.  Sreynich has struggled to make a living through employment at one company in a local area.  Sreynich has been engaged in her job for several months and she is able to earn about $3 per day to support the family. 

Sreynich has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before.  Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund.  She requests a loan to pay for her university tuition fees, where she is specializing in accounting.  She hopes this loan will enable her to pursue her degree so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for his farm

loans.name: Basheer

texts.en:
Basheer is 45 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a very simple house in Gaza city. Basheer works as an employee in a local company, where he gets a low income. 

Basheer has a problem with his feet. He needs to do surgery so he can go back to work. 

Basheer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do urgent surgery on his legs. This will help him to get better and go back to work. 

Basheer appears in the photo

loans.use: to do urgent surgery on his legs

loans.name: Tayiana

texts.en: Tayiana is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be trustworthy and respectful. She sells clothes to earn a living and sells animals to earn extra income. She describes her family challenge to be a lack of water. She will use the KES 41,500 loan to buy a 6,000-litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will do dairy farming. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 150,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a 6,000-litre water tank

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 51-year-old, rural villager from Kompot Province's Banteay Meas district.  She has 4 children, one of whom is still in school.  Here, rice farming is a popular business in the neighborhood.  Touch is a rice farmer who has been growing rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland.  Having engaged in this business for 31 years, Touch is able to save up to 6,000 KHR per day after deducting the expenses.

This is the first cycle loan for Touch with Kiva's partner, VisionFund.  Touch is applying for an educational loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her oldest son, a 21-year-old freshman in a local university.  She highly hopes that this loan will enable her son to attend the university, to obtain a higher education, and to end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her son’s university tuition fees.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 32 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, ya posee clientela fija que la prefieren por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gasto del hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, Marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y poder seguir con su trabajo y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 32 years old. She is dedicated to breeding and selling chickens in the markets found near her home. She already has set clientele that prefer her unbeatable prices. What she receives from her sales helps her with her household expenses. She lives with her life partner and her three children. She is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the chickens, and so that she can continue with her work and have a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: To purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is 20 years old and single. He lives with his family in Jenin city. 

For the past year, Fares has been working with a small truck in construction work. He transfers construction materials to contractors. It is a hard business but it is also very profitable. 

Fares took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to fix the wheels of his truck and do some maintenance. 

By applying this loan, Fares will be able to improve his truck. He will be able to transfer more materials for the contractors. His income will increase. 

Fares appears in the photo

loans.use: to fix the wheels of his truck and do some maintenance.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is 43 years old and married.  From Rafah city, he is the father of three sons and one daughter. 

Sami is an employee in the public sector, where he gets a very low income. Sami tries to provide his family all they need, so he works after his job in transfering soft drinks and kids' food from the factory to supermarkets in the city. 

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell to local supermarkets. This will improve his business and also his income

loans.use: to buy more products to resell to local supermarkets

loans.name: Noris Del Carmen

texts.es: Noris de 22 años de edad, es soltera y habita en casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año emprendió un negocio de venta de minutas (postre a base de hielo rallado y jarabe de sabores) y papas fritas. Dicho negocio lo ha acomodado en su lugar de residencia y hasta la fecha los resultados han sido muy aceptables ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y poco a poco sus productos van siendo más demandados por sus vecinos. Con el fin de abarcar a un número mayor de clientes ha tomado la decisión de invertir en la compra de un carretón para salir a vender las minutas y así dar a conocer más su producto. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la compra de un carretón y los insumos necesarios para el negocio tales como: variedad de jarabes de frutas, y papas para la venta de papas fritas.
texts.en:
Noris is 22 years old, single, and lives at her parents' house. A year ago, she launched a business selling minutas (a dessert of shave ice and fruit syrup) and French fries. 

She has placed this business in her home, and until now the results have been very acceptable. She has many customers and little by little her products are more in-demand by her neighbors. 

With the goal of taking on more a higher number of customers, she has taken the decision to invest in the purchase of a small cart for going out to sell the minutas and in that way making her product more public. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to purchase the small cart and the necessary supplies for the business like: variety of fruit syrups, and potatoes for the sale of French fries.

loans.use: to buy a small cart to sell minutas (Salvadoran shave ice), fruit syrups, and potatoes.

loans.name: Mojahed

texts.en:
Mojahed, appearing in the photo, is a 21-year-old single young man from Jenin. For the past three years, he has been selling fruits and vegetables in the city using a small cart. It is a good job and earns a good income. 

Mojahed took a USD loan from FATEN; this loan will help him to open a small shop and buy more fruits and vegetables to resell. This loan will provide him with the needed liquidity for his business.

loans.use: to open a small shop and buy more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad, appearing in the photo, is a 23-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He is a father for one small son. Iyad is a worker in a construction field. He works outside his city and his income is not fixed due to his ability to reach the place he works in. Iyad's son has a problem in hearing. He needs some treatment and a hearing headset.

Iyad took a USD loan from FATEN; this loan will help to buy a headset for his son. This loan will help Iyad in part of the urgent expenses he has.

loans.use: to buy a hearing headset for his son

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married, and has three children. She sells clothing at the local market. This business is the main source of income for her family. Maria is asking for a loan of 5,000 hryvnas to increase winter inventories. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profits for her family. Maria has a hobby - to go out to the mountains with her family and pick mushrooms.

loans.use: to increase winter inventories

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat is 49 years old and a rural villager residing in Stoung district of Kampong Thom Province. She has 2 children, one of whom is the student. To overcome the daily financial burden in the family, she sells farming rice whiles her husband is a fisherman in the village. 
 
Yat has been with VisionFund for past two cycles and she has completely repaid back with success. The subsequent loans have enabled her to maintain her living condition. She is now requesting for a loan to cover the tuition fee for her daughter’s university. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her daughter, so she can focus on her studying and obtain a good job after the graduation.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fee for her daughter’s university

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is a citizen from a rural area located in Kampong Thom province’s Kampong Svay district. She is 19 years old and single. To make a living, she has been working at one company in her village. She is able to earn up to US$4 per day from the business that she has been with for several months and she can manage to save only US$2 each day for future needs. 

Sreymom has never been with VisionFund before; she is requesting her first loan. She is going to use this loan to spend on her tuition fees for four years of her bachelor degree majoring in Accounting. This loan will enable her to stay in university.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Alba Cristina

texts.es: Alba de 38 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña de 9 años.  Ella trabaja muy duro para sacer adelante a su hija quien es su principal inspiración.  Desde hace un tiempo se dedica a la venta de pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.), papas fritas y licuados de frutas.  El negocio lo ha adecuado en su lugar de habitación y todos los días se ocupa de el para lograr sacar los ingresos diarios. Tiene muchos clientes ya que los productos que ofrece son de buena calidad y a precios accesibles. Últimamente, ha notado que la demanda de sus productos es mayor  por lo que ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su pequeño negocio para cubrir la demanda y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (maíz, frijoles, queso, frutas, papas, aceite, etc.), para su negocio. Alba expresa tener la capacidad para pagar las cuotas de dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Alba is 38 years old. She is a single mother of a 9-year-old girl.  She works very hard to move forward for her daughter, who is her main inspiration. 

For a long time she has made a living in the sale of pupusas (food prepared with corn flour, beans, cheese, etc.), french fries, and fruit smoothies. The business has adequate space and every day it manages to get daily income. She has many customers since the products offered are of good quality and affordable prices. 

Lately, she has noticed that the demand for her products is higher so she has decided to invest in her small business to meet the demand and thus improve her income. She applied for a FUSAI loan to invest in the purchase of necessary inputs (corn, beans, cheese, fruits, potatoes, oil, etc.) for her business. Alba expressed that she has the ability to pay the installments of the loan.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, fruit, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his university tuition for four years

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Aman is a 25-year-old single woman from Jenin City. She lives with her family in a simple house. Aman's brother works in a small store where he makes perfumes from raw perfumes. It is a good business, and he is a very talented man. 

Aman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her brother to buy more raw materials for his store. This will help him develop his business so his income will increase.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her brother's store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new machines for cutting aluminum for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 38-year-old married woman from a small village near the city of Nablus. She is a mother with one son and three daughters. Amneh's husband works as a construction worker in a temporary job. Amneh would like to help her husband for part of the family's expenses. She opened a small kids clothes store few months ago. It is a good project, but has a seasonal income. 

Amneh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her store for the Eid season. This loan will improve her business and also her income. 

Amneh appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store for the Eid season.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - An Thanh 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhai is 54 years old, employed in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND. She is married and has one son. Her son is in high school, but he has poor health and is often sick. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1988. 

Currently, the family’s toilet does not flush. With this loan, Nhai will use the fund to build a septic tank. She hopes that the new latrine will help improve their living conditions, protecting the health of family members from waterborne diseases and contributing to environmental protection. 

In the photo, Nhai is standing on the left.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Nhóm 9 - An Thanh 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Men is 58 years old, employed in agriculture with a monthly income of about 700,000 VND. She and her husband live with two grown children and two grandchildren, who are attending high school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1971. 

Currently, the family has no flushing toilet, so family members often have to borrow their neighbors’ latrine. With this loan, Mrs Men will use the fund to build a septic tank to improve living conditions, improve the health of her family members and contribute to environmental protection. In the photo, Men stands on the right.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Nhóm 4 - An Thanh 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quy is 31 years old, employed in agriculture with a monthly income of about 800,000 VND. She is married and has two children who are of school age. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2002. 

Quy realized that using an unhygienic latrine would contaminate the environment, adversely affecting the health of her family members in particular and the community in general. But due to lack of funds, her family still has no flushing toilets. Quy will use this loan to build a septic tank latrine to improve sanitation, promote health for members of her family and contribute to environmental protection. In the photo, she stands fifth to the left.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Nhóm 3 - An Thanh 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phuong is 30 years old, engaged in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately 700,000 VND. She is married and has two small children. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2012. 

Currently, the family has no flushing toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a septic tank to improve living conditions, improve the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection. 

In the picture, Phuong is fifth from the left side.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Nhóm 5 - An Thanh 01 Group

texts.en:
Ms Lau is 62 years old this year. She and her husband are engaged in agricultural production with a total monthly income of about 1,400,000 VND. She has three grown children who have been living separately. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1969. 

Currently, the house that Mrs Lau and her husband live in doesn't have a flushing toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a septic tank latrine to improve sanitation and health for her family, while contributing to environmental protection. 

In the photo, she stands on the far right.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ratha is 27 years old and married with three children, all of whom are dependents on her. To support her family, she has been growing cassava and also working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about 24,000KHR per day and can save about 14,000KHR each day for the future needs.

This is the microloan for Ratha with VisionFund and she is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Eduardo Miguel

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete en el distrito de Imperial, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Eduardo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Eduardo trabaja como agente de seguridad brindando servicios de vigilancia en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Eduardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea cercar con materiales adecuados y resistentes la parte trasera de su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 31-year-old man, single, lives in the city of Canete in the Imperial district, he is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and puts all his efforts into getting ahead; unfortunately due to lack of economic resources and the need to work, Eduardo wasn't able to study a professional degree in Law.  Through his own initiative, Eduardo works as a security agent providing services in his city, he works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks he does well thanks to his dedication and effort.
Eduardo is very thankful to the lenders of Kiva, because thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his residence, he wishes to make a fence in the back part of his house with adequate and strong materials, this way he will continue to work and make an effort to achieve his dream of one day be able to study and have a career.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat is aged 31 years and living with her family members in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three dependent children. Rice farming, cassava and cashew planting have been the main sources for her family’s income for 12 years. The current business earns her about 56,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000KHR each day for the future needs.

Sarat has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the loans. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s living conditions and now she is confident to make a better living. Now she is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s lifestyle and build on her savings to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Isabel con su credikiva, con el cual compró al pormayor y de contado  t4elas, hilos, botones, correderas, etc, con los que confeccionó ropa en general. Su credíto la benefició  porque aumentó su liquidéz, se incremntaron sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una fileteadora para darle un mejor terminado a sus prendas y dejar de pagar alquiler por la tarea de fileteo. Con ella ahorrará tiempos productivos y sobre todo dará curso al aumento de su calidad en las prendas que confecciona.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Isabel with creditkiva, with the loan she bought in cash and at wholesale prices fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc., with which she designed clothing.  Her loan benefited her because it increased her liquidity, her sales and her profits.  She is currently applying for credikiva, through it she will buy a serger to put better finishing touches to her items and stop paying fees to have them done by someone else.  With it she will save production time and above all she will be able to increase the quality of the clothes she makes.

loans.use: to buy a serger.

loans.name: Morena Del Carmen

texts.es: Morena de 38 años de edad es madre soltera, posee un negocio de venta de refrescos y licuados desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, Morena está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: fresas, naranjas, guineos, papayas, chocolates, azúcar, leche,  hielo, etc. para seguir con su negocio y poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Morena is 38, a single mother, and has had a business for several years that sells sodas and smoothies, her business is located at her place of residence in a high traffic area.  With her earnings from sales she is able to cover the home expenses, she lives with her two sons in a house they own, Morena is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as: strawberries, oranges, banana, papaya, chocolate, sugar, milk, ice, etc. to continue with her business and have better earnings and give her sons more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy strawberries, oranges, banana, papaya, chocolate, sugar, milk, ice, etc.

loans.name: G.s El Cerro Group

texts.es:
La Señora Norma es una persona luchadora y honesta  vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 5 nietos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas desde hace 10 años, las cuales vende desde su casa  de habitación a los vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Norma al igual que sus compañeras de grupo está solicitando el préstamo para su negocio para la compra de más materia prima como ser cal, leña y maíz los  necesita para la elaboración de su producto.
Doña Norma espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto, además espera un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien su estilo de vida y el de su familia. Ella espera hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia  para que tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.
Doña Paula tiene 53 años, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años.
Doña Cinthia tiene 23 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de mariscos desde hace 3 años.
Don Arles tiene 31 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de mariscos desde hace 8 años.
Doña Dilcia tiene 21 años, su negocio es la elaboración ya venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking and honest person, she lives in a community south of Honduras with her husband and five grandchildren.  For 10 years her business has been the making and sale of tortillas, she sells them from her house to the neighbors of her community.
Norma and her group are requesting a loan for their businesses, she wants to buy raw materials such as lime, firewood and corn needed to make her product.
Norma hopes that the loan will be very helpful because she will have all the inputs needed to continue making her product, she also expect an increase in sales and this way have more income that benefit her and her family's lifestyle.  She hopes to grow her business and this way continue to support her family so that they have opportunities in the future.
Paula is 53, her business for 10 years has been to make and sell tortillas
Cinthia is 23, her business for 3 years has been to buy and sell seafood.
Arles is 31, his business for 8 years has been to buy and sell seafood.
Dilcia is 21, her business for 2 years has been to make and sell tortillas.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy lime, firewood and corn for her business.

loans.name: Odila Del Carmen

texts.es: Odilia de 36 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con sus padres, su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos, agua, gaseosas, refrescos, etc. ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por lo buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos que s ele presentan en su hogar, Odilia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes cuando le llegan a comprar para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Odilia is 36, lives at her parents' house with her husband and two children, she has a business that sells juices, water, sodas, refreshments, etc. It was established at her residence several years ago, she has many customers for the good prices and service she provides, with what she makes from her sales and with her husband's help they are able to cover the expenses that they have at home, Odilia is requesting a loan to buy wholesale products to continue with her business and provide better service to her customers and also have better earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy juices, water, sodas, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Aged 43 years, Vuth is the married mother of one child living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are rice farmers. She has been in the business for 25 years and she can earn about 48,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Vuth with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Vuth is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice production and increase her family’s income and she hopes to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells clothes. He describes his family challenge to be lack of clean water. He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a water harvesting facility that will benefit three family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be strong and have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy a water harvesting facility

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She describes her family challenge to be harvesting clean water. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy a water harvesting facility that will benefit four family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 60,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water harvesting facility

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as motivated. She sells clothes to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be a lack of clean water for drinking. She will use the KES 15,170 loan to buy a water purifier and a water dispenser which will benefit 10 family members. They will be able to access clean water for drinking. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water purifier and a water dispenser

loans.name: Selipher

texts.en: Selipher is a 43-year-old woman. She describes herself as very productive and patient. She does farming to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water to do household chores. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase a water pump and water pipes. They will be able to bring water close to her home for domestic use and also for farming. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and water pipes

loans.name: Firuzshoh

texts.ru: Фирузшох 43-летний женатый человек, имеет троих детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Вахш. Фирузшох по профессии строитель, он в течение 15 лет строит дома и делает ремонт в квартирах. Дети Фирузшох подросли и им нужен дом побольше. Фирузшох начал строить дом для своей семьи, но из-за обстоятельств и непредвиденных расходов у него закончились деньги и ему не хватает средств, чтобы построить крышу. Скоро зима и Фирузшох всеми способами пытается найти деньги чтобы до зимы поставить крышу - чтобы его семье зимой было где остаться. Поэтому с такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Помогите Фирузшоху построить крышу до зимы!
texts.en: Firuzshoh is a 43 year-old married man, who has three children.  He and his family live in the Vakhsh district.  Firuzshoh is a construction worker.  He has been building houses and doing repairs in apartments for 15 years.  Firuzshoh's children have grown up and need a bigger house.  Firuzshoh started to build a house for his family, but due to circumstances and unplanned expenses, he ran out of money and does not have enough to build a roof.  Winter is coming soon, and Firuzshoh had been trying everything possible to find money to put the roof up before the winter, so that his family had a place to live.  This is why he requested this loan.  Help Firuzshoh to build the roof before the winter!

loans.use: to build a roof for his house before the winter

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 50-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 13 years to 29 years. She describes herself as social and trendy. She does farming to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be frequent water shortages. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase iron sheets for roofing. They will also enable her to harvest rain water for domestic use in her house. She hopes that in the future, she will always have water  in her homestead for farming and household chores. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 25,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for roofing

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 43-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 23 years. She describes herself as ambitious and outgoing. She does farming to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be the long distances to fetch water. 
She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water pump and pipes. They will be able to pump water to their home for domestic use. 
This will benefit four family members. She hopes that in the future, they will have a water storage facility for the neighborhood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase a water pump and pipes

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 57 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like chips, mineral water, bread, soft drinks, etc.

Elvie has been in this business for 27 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like chips, mineral water, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Elsie has been raising ducks for four years and also earns additional income from making and selling ice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Jacklord

texts.en:
Jacklord is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for his tricycle transportation business.

Jacklord successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business.

NWTF is re-listing Jacklord's business profile again in support of his efforts to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 51 years old and married with five children.

Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods like soap, canned goods, eggs and noodles to sell.

Elvie has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane and raising pigs.

Elvie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods like soap, canned goods, eggs and noodles to sell

loans.name: Maria Arlyn

texts.en:
Maria Arlyn is 46 years old and married with two children.

Maria Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Maria Arlyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maria Arlyn aspires to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Real Sociedad Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cuatro socias luchadoras y trabajadoras  uno de ellas es  Josefa, tiene la edad de 22 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la compra y venta de cosecha desde hace 10 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año y medio lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona muy capaz y responsable en sus cuotas. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo y nancite. Julia tiene 44 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida, Angelita tiene la edad de 35 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosecha y Juana tiene la edad de 33 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosecha.
texts.en:
The group is made up of four go-getting and hard-working members. One of these is Josefa, who is 22. She lives with her common-law husband and has two dependent children. She has had a business buying and selling crops for 10 years. She has been a customer of the institution for a year and a half, which has proven she is a capable and responsible person in her payments. She is asking for a loan to buy crops of tamarind and nancite [a small, yellow Central American fruit].

Julia is 44 and her business is the sale of food. Angelita is 35 and her business is the buying and selling of crops. Juana is 33 and her business is the buying and selling of crops.

loans.use: to buy crops of tamarind and nancite

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr: La cliente Justine est un leader  du collectif de crédit  « Shalom », entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans  et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un photographe. La cliente est une vendeuse des Fanta. Elle installe  ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le fonds additionnel du prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 35 casiers de Fanta. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et étendre son entreprise. La vente en crédit est un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Justine is a leader for the "Shalom" credit loan group. She is an experienced, dynamic entrepreneur, aged 35 and the mother of two children both in school. Her husband is a photographer.

She sells Fanta (soft drinks) and stocks her products at home. She started the business with her own funds received from her husband. Later, she benefited from additional funding loaned by the Hekima MFI. She has been running her business for the past eight years.

This new loan will be used to buy 35 crates of Fanta. She wants to ensure her children's education and expand her business activity. Selling on credit is a challenge for the development of her business.

In conclusion, she greatly thanks Hekima for helping to empower non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during a critical time of war in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: buy 35 crates of Fanta (soft drink)

loans.name: Amazone Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AMAZONE est formé de treize personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yvone est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Yvone est âgée de 51 ans, et est mariée à un certain Théophile. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yvone et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Il y a sept ans que Yvone vend des poulets et du maïs dans un marché du Bénin ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Yvone achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Yvone et les autres membres du groupement AMAZONE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Amazon group consists of three persons from the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group, Yvone, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo.

Yvone is 51 years old and is married to Theophile. The couple has four children, all in school and who are their dependents. Yvone and her husband live together with their children.

For the past seven years Yvone has been selling chickens and corn in one of Benin's markets. This enables her to deal with various family expenses, together with her ​​husband. Yvone buys her products in Benin.

This is the first time Yvone and other members of the Amazon group have sought a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to bolster their activity to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Buy chickens and bags of corn

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулноре 34 года. У нее есть сын. Ему 2 года, она его растит одна. Гулнора развелась с мужем, когда ребенок был совсем маленьким и сейчас она вместе с сыном живут в городе Куляб в доме у сестры. 
  Около 2-х лет Гулнора готовит и продает еду на местном рынке. Много продавцов питается из ее кухни. Гулнора готовит еду у себя дома и потом привозит на рынок. В ее меню входит национальная кухня. Она готовит различные супы, плов, пирожки, пирожное и другие разные кондитерские изделия и блюда.
   Скоро в Таджикистане начнутся праздники, и Гулнора берет кредит, чтобы закупить продукты и приготовить больше блюд. Ближе к праздникам на рынке появится больше клиентов и Гулнора будет кормить не только продавцов, но и покупателей.
texts.en: Gulnora is 34 years old.  She has a son, who is two years old.  She is raising him on her own.  Gulnora got divorced from her husband when the child was very little and now she and her son live in the city of Kulob at her sister's house.  Gulnora has been preparing and selling food at a local market for about two years.  Many salespeople eat from her kitchen.  Gulnora prepares the food at home and then delivers it to the market.  Her menu includes national dishes.  She prepares various soups, pilaf, piroshki, cakes and various other baked goods and dishes.  Holidays will soon start in Tajikistan, and Gulnora is requesting this loan to purchase products and prepare more dishes.  There will be more customers closer to the holidays, and Gulnora will be feeding not only other salespeople, but customers as well.

loans.use: to purchase products to prepare food

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.ru: Мохинисо пережила много тягости жизни. Ее муж трагически погиб. Он был врачом. Мохинисо одна вырастила своих 5 детей. Она работает в государственном учреждении. Ей было очень трудно обеспечивать детей со всеми необходимыми средствами, так как она получала маленькую зарплату. Данное время ее сыновья выросли стали подрабатывать в Российской Федерации. С помощью детей она постепенно улучшает условию проживания. Мохинисо должна купить авиабилет своим сыновьям, так как она не имеет достаточно денег, она обратилась за займом. Мохинисо запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для своих сыновей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mohiniso lived through a lot of difficulties in life.  Her husband tragically died.  He was a doctor.  Mohiniso raised five of her children by herself.  She works at a government organization.  It was very hard for her to provide the children with all of the necessities because she earned a small salary.  At the present time, her sons have grown up and started to work in the Russian Federation.  She is gradually able to improve living conditions with the help of the children.  Mohiniso has to purchase airline tickets for her sons, but because she does not have enough money, she requested a loan.  Mohiniso is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase airline tickets for her sons.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase airline tickets for her sons

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида является одной из таких личностей, которая может вести своё дело успешно. Она молодая  перспективная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети еще несовершеннолетние. Умида замужем за сварщика. Он добрый человек. Умида начала свой бизнес купле продажей масла 7 лет назад. Вначале она помогала брату и набрала достаточно опыта. После замужества она начала заниматься бизнесом самостоятельно. Она торгует и оптом и в розницу. Умида умеет налаживать хорошие отношения с поставщиками. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
