texts.en: Umida is one of those people, who can successfully run her business.  She is a young and promising woman.  She is 26 years old.  She is married and raising two children.  Her children are not of age yet.  Umida is married to a welder.  He is a kind person.  Umida started her own business of buying and selling oil 7 years ago.  At first, she had helped her brother and gained enough experience.  After getting married, she started to run her business by herself.  She sells wholesale and retail.  Umida can create good relationships with distributors.  She plans to repair her house because her house is in a bad condition.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase building materials, such as cement, paint, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, such as cement, paint, etc., to repair her house

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupement de seize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain René. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Marie prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, poissons frits) qu’elle vend dans son quartier. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Marie et les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Mahugnon is a group of sixteen persons, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 58 years old and is married to René.

The couple has four children, all attending (or having attended) school and who are their dependents. In addition to their children, the couple has another child under their care. Mary lives together with her children and her husband. The couple shares the various household expenses.

For nearly ten years Marie has been preparing food (corn dough, fried fish) she sells in her neighborhood. Mary gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

This is the first time that Mary and the other members of the Mahugnon group seek financial support from ALIDé, to bolster their working capital and their activity, and better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: buy corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Saint Antoine De Padou 2 Group

texts.fr: SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Lucien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Christine prépare depuis près six ans, de la nourriture qu'elle vend de façon ambulante. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Christine et les autres membres du groupement SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les prêts reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 is a group of 13 members, all of whom live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Christine (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is 29 years old and married to a painter named Lucien. The couple have four children that they take care of. Christine did not attend school. She lives with her children and husband. Together, the couple takes care of the various responsibilities of their home. In order to contribute to this, Christine has been preparing and selling food in an itinerant way for the past six years. She stocks up on merchandise at a market in Benin. This is the third loan Christine and the other members of the SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 group are requesting from ALIDE, in order to reinforce their working capital and their businesses, and better respond to customer demands. All previous loans were successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Ayidote I Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE I est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupement, Rosine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Lazare. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Rosine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Rosine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de six ans, Rosine vend du maïs et divers produits dans une région du Bénin. Rosine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Rosine et les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE  I sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: AYIDOTE I is a group of 13 persons, all of whom live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Rosine (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is 31 years old and married to a man named Lazare. The couple have four children, all of whom they are responsible for, and a few of whom attend school. Rosine did not attend school. She lives with her children and her husband. Together, the couple take care of the different needs of their home. For nearly six years, Rosine has been selling maize and other products in a region of Benin. She stocks up at the market in Benin. This is the second loan Rosine and the other members of the AYIDOTE I group ask for financial support from ALIDE, in order to reinforce their working capital and their commercial activities, and better respond to their customer requests. The previous loan was successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: Purchase maize

loans.name: Ayidote Ii Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYIDOTE II est composé de vingt personnes qui résident dans le même village. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Léontine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Léontine est âgée de 53 ans et est une veuve. Léontine a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Léontine vit avec son enfant à charge et assure ses différentes charges. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Léontine vend depuis une trentaine d'année, des fruits et de la farine de manioc dans une région du Bénin. Léontine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Léontine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE II, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The AYIDOTE II group is composed of 20 persons who live in the same village. This is the first time the group is asking for financial support from ALIDE, in order to increase their level of commercial activity. The representative of the group, Léontine, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. Léontine is a 53 year old widow. She has six children, some of whom attend school, and only one of whom is still under her responsibility. Léontine lives with this one child and take care of its needs. In order to do this, Léontine has been selling fruits and manioc flour in a region of Benin for the past thirty years. She stocks up in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her level of commercial activity and her sales, Léontine is asking, alongside the other member of the AYIDOTE II, for her first loan from ALIDE.

loans.use: purchase fruits

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFONSI est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Célestine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Célestine est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Frédéric. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et quatre restent à leur charge. Célestine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Célestine vend depuis cinq ans, du haricot préparé dans sa région. Célestine s'approvisionne dans sa région au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Célestine et les autres membres du groupement FIFONSI sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi group is made up of 12 people who live in the same village. The group's representative, whose name is Célestine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With a view to expanding their businesses so that they can meet customer demand, this group is for the second time seeking financial support from Alidé. 

Célestine did not attend school and she is now 40 years old and married to a farmer named Frédéric. The couple has seven children, some of whom are at school and four of whom are dependants. Célestine and her husband live with their children and cover the various household expenses between them. In order to be able to contribute to these expenses, Célestine has for the past five years been selling beans which are prepared in her region. She gets her supplies from this region in Benin. With a view to expanding their businesses and better satisfying customer demand, Célestine and the other members of the Fifonsi group are requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Echo De Anges 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Denise est la coordinatrice de son groupe Echo des Anges 1, 2 & 3. Elle est mariée elle a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Denise dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire pendants les 6 dernières années.

Avant de ce commerce elle était la vendeuse de toute sorte. Elle espère que ce emprunt l’aidera agrandir son commerce. Des autres membres de groupe ont besoin d'un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. Elle dit que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans la zone. Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Denise is the coordinator of the Echo des Anges 1,2 &3 group. She is married and has two children. She lives in the north-eastern region of Haïti where electricity is rare and drinkable water very limited. Denise has been running her grocery business for the past six years.

Before beginning this business she was a saleswoman of all sorts of products. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. The other members of the group need loans for businesses such as the sale of cosmetics, fizzy drinks, etc. Denise says that her main challenge is to become a more significant businesswoman in the area. Her main aim is to have a bigger business which will enable her to build a large house with the help of a loan from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mawulome Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAWULOME est composé de dix huit personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Léocardie est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Léocardie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Léocardie est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Sébastien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Léocardie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant à charge et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Léocardie produit depuis une vingtaine d'année, de la farine de manioc à base de manioc, et vend son produit dans une région du Bénin. Léocardie s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Léocardie  et les autres membres du groupement MAWULOME sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Mawulome group is made up of 18 people who live in the same village. The group's representative, whose name is Léocardie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With a view to expanding their businesses so that they can meet customer demand more readily, this group is for the first time seeking financial support from Alidé.

Léocardie attended school very little and she is now 43 years old and married to a man named Sébastien. The couple has four children, some of whom are educated and only one of whom is a dependant. Léocardie and her husband live with their one dependant child and cover the various household expenses between them. In order to be able to contribute to providing for the family's needs, Léocardie has for the past 20 years or so been making cassava flour from cassava, and she sells her product in a region of Benin. She gets her supplies in her region. 

With a view to expanding their businesses and better satisfying customer demand, Léocardie and the other members of the Mawulome group are requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy cassava in order to make cassava flour.

loans.name: L'espoir 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Roland est le coordinateur de son groupe L'Espoir 4, 5 & 6. Il es un commercant. tous les membres de ce groupe vivent dans la région DE BOR DE MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Roland a dirigé son commerce pendant 6 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Il était un etudiant.

Roland voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit divers(cosmetiques, chaussures, vetements). Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce de produit divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Divers produit. Il dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Roland is the coordinator of the L'Espoir 4,5 & 6 group. He is a trader. All the members of this group live in the De Bor de Mer region where electricity is rare and water very limited. Roland has been carrying out his business for the past six years. Before that he was a student.

Roland would like to use this loan to invest in a variety of products (cosmetics, shoes, clothes). He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his multi-product business. The other activist members need loans for businesses such as his, for example. He says that his main challenge is to become a more significant businessman.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Le Modele De Dorneu Group

texts.fr:
Kercita est la coordonatrice de son groupe Le Modele de Dorneu. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants. Kercita habite dans la région de nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Kercita a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 9 dernières années. 

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle a vendu l'artisanat. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du Vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Kercita espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres Le Modele De Dorneau ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, la nourritures, cosmetique et chaussures. Kercita dit que ses défis principal est de un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Kercita is the coordinator for Le Modele de Borneu group. She is married and has five children. She lives in the northern region of Haïti, where electricity is rare and water very limited. She has managed her business selling a variety of products for the past nine years. Before that she sold handicrafted articles. 

Kercita would like to use this loan to expand her business. The other members of Le Modele de Dorneau group need loans for businesses such as the purchase and sale of charcoal, food, cosmetics and shoes. Kercita says that her main challenge is to become a significant businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es: Filena es una de las tres socias emprendedoras y luchadoras tiene la edad de 45 años, casada, con un hijo menor, su negocio es un taller de zapatería  en su domicilio desde hace 12 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4  años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de calzado como esponja, suelas, hebillas, pega, forro, etc. Modesta tiene la edad de 44 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almohada y cobertores. María tiene 69 años y su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en: Filena is one of three enterprising members who are fighters. She is 45 years old, married and has a minor child. Her business has been a cobbler's shop  in her house for 12 years. She has been a client of the institution for 4 years. She is asking for the loan to buy shoemaking materials such as sponges, soles, buckles, glue, lining, etc. Modesta is 44 and makes and sells pillows and covers. María is 69 and her business is a general store.

loans.use: to buy shoemaking materials such as sponges, soles, buckles, glue, lining, etc.

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por tres socias luchadoras y trabajadoras  una de ellas Ana mujer de 36 años, acompañada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años, ella las vende en su comunidad. El crédito lo está solicitando para  la compra de insumos como es quintal de maíz,  flete de leña, cal. Rosa tiene la edad de 22 años su negocio es la venta de sandalias y chinelas y Rebeca tiene 45 años de edad se dedica al negocio de vender cajetas ambulante en Managua.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking women.  One of them is Ana, who is 36 years old, married, and has two young children.  She has worked selling tortillas for more than 15 years. She sells the tortillas in her community.  She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as a quintal of corn, a load of firewood, and lime.  

Rosa is 22 years old and works selling sandals and Rebeca is 45 years old and works selling caramels as a street vendor in Managua.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as a quintal of corn, a load of firewood, and lime.

loans.name: La Diferencia Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado  por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María Isabel, tiene la edad de 45 años, viuda, su negocio es la venta de varios como calzado, repostería, hielo desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de  calzado cerrado, sandalias altas, sandalias bajas para niñas y adulta. Julia mujer de 56 años su negocio es una tapicería de muebles y colchones y Lilliam mujer de 47 años su negocio es la venta de calzado
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising women.  One of them is Maria Isabel, who is 45 years old and widowed.  She has worked selling various items such as shoes, pastries, and ice for five years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase closed shoes, high heeled sandals, and flat sandals for women and girls.

Julia is 56 years old and works selling mattresses and upholstering furniture.  Lilliam is 47 years old and works selling shoes.

loans.use: to purchase closed shoes, high heeled sandals, and flat sandals for women and girls.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, egg chips, beads, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Flora has been in this business for one year. Flora earns other income from food vending.

Flora has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, egg chips, beads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Savn

texts.en:
Savn is 27 years old and married, with three children. She lives in a peaceful village of Prey Chhor district, in Kampong Cham province. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice both for sustenance and sale. She has been in her business for over ten years and earns a net profit of KHR 5,000 per day, which she uses to cover her daily costs.

She always seeks ways to improve her income and better her living conditions, which is why she has applied for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 from a longstanding Kiva partner, HKL, to cover the costs of food and traveling fees of her husband, who plans to work as a paid laborer in Thailand, where they expect to generate a good income. 

She hopes that the loan will bring additional revenue to her family to improve the general living status. She appeared in the photo with her husband in front of their house.

loans.use: to cover food and traveling fees of her husband, who plans to work as a paid laborer in Thailand.

loans.name: Lagrimas De Cristal Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias  microempresarias una de ellas es Katherine tiene la edad de 20 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de platanitos y frito ambulante en el parque de Granada, mercado y colegios desde hace 2 años, el crédito lo está requiriendo para la compra de materia prima como es canasto de plátanos, aceite, leña, bolsas, carne de cerdo, repollo, etc. Xiomara tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de ropa de niño y Irma tiene la edad de 47 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas y pinol.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members who are micro-businesswomen. One of them is Katherine. She is 20 years old, married, and her business has been selling fried plantains and fried meat as a street vendor in the Granada park, the market and at high schools for 2 years. She needs the loan to buy raw materials such as plantains, oil, firewood, bags, pork, cabbage, etc. Xiomara is 23 years old and her business is selling children's clothes and Irma is 47 and her business is selling tortillas and pinol.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as a basket of plantains, oil, firewood, bags, pork, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupana Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias exitosas una de ellas es Rosa mujer de 50 años de edad,acompañada, su negocio es la venta de hojas desde hace 5 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de lio de hojas. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años. Silvia mujer de 46 años su negocio es una clínica veterinaria y Bertha mujer de 39 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful women.  One of them is Rosa, who is 50 years old and married.  She has worked selling leaves for five years, and she is requesting this loan to purchase a bundle of leaves.  She has been a client of this institution for five years.

Silvia is 46 years old and works at a veterinary clinic and Bertha is 39 years old and sells clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of leaves.

loans.name: Nenas De Los Angeles Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cinco socios emprendedores y luchadores uno de ellos es Luz tiene la edad de 47 años, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosechas desde hace 22 años. El crédito lo requiere para comprar ropa interior  como blúmeres, brazieres, bóxer de varón, licras y cosecha de tamarindo. Wilber tiene la edad de 30 años su negocio es la agricultura, siembra pipián y chilotes, Jenny tiene 42 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo, Santa mujer de 41 años su negocio es la venta de frutas y Jerónima mujer de 46 años su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five enterprising and hardworking members.  One of them is Luz, who is 47 years old, married, and has two children in her care.  She has worked selling clothing and harvesting for 22 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase underwear such as women's underwear, bras, boxers, pantyhose, and to harvest tamarind.  

Wilber is 30 years old and he works as a farmer, planting chiles and corn.  Jenny is 42 years old and works buying and selling tamarind harvests.  Santa is 41 years old and works selling fruit, and Jeronima is 46 years old and works selling corn products such as pinol (a drink made from roasted corn flour) and pinolillo (a sweet corn and cocoa drink).

loans.use: to purchase underwear such as women's underwear, bras, boxers, pantyhose, and to harvest tamarind.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es: Juliana es una de las tres integrantes del grupo tiene la edad de 50 años, soltera, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo requiere para surtir más su negocio y comprar al por mayor granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabones, papel higiénico, café, gaseosas, productos lácteos, chiverías, etc. Carla tiene la edad de 33 años su negocio es la venta de fritanga y sopa, Silvia tiene 35 años su negocio es la venta de ropa interior.
texts.en: Juliana is one of three members of the group. She is 50 years old, single and raising two children. Her business is a general store located in her business for 5 years. She needs the loan to stock her business more and buy basic grains wholesale such as rice, as well as sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, coffee, sodas, dairy products, snacks, etc. Carla is 33 and her business is selling fritanga and soup. Silvia is 35 and her business is selling underwear.

loans.use: to stock her business more and buy basic grains wholesale such as rice, as well as sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, coffee, sodas, dairy products, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por  tres socias trabajadoras y luchadoras una de ellas es Scarleth tiene la edad de 25 años, acompañada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio la compra y venta de cosecha desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo requiere para comprar cosecha de mangos. Zeneida mujer de 32 años de edad su negocio es la venta de frutas y Eneida tiene la edad de 37 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking and fighting women.  On of these women is Scarleth.  She is twenty-five years old, is in a relationship, and has two young children.  She has been in the business of buying and selling harvested fruits and vegetables for five years.  

The loan that she requests is to purchase harvested mangos.  

The other members are Zenedia, a 32-year-old woman who sells fruit, and Eneida, a 37-year-old woman whose business is selling used clothing.

loans.use: to buy harvested mangos.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cuatro socios emprendedores uno de ellos es María Antonia mujer de 41 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos, su negocio es un taller de carpintería  desde hace  6 años, su marido es quien se encarga de la elaboración de camas. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de madera, lijas, sellador, laca. María Auxiliadora tiene la edad  de 45 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y tortillas, Cintia mujer de 35 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Roberto tiene la edad de 30 años su negocio taller de mueblería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising individuals.  The featured member is Maria Antonia.  She is forty-one years old, is in a relationship, and has two children.  She has had a carpentry workshop for six years, and her husband is the one in charge of creating the bed frames.  

The loan she is requesting is to purchase wood, sandpaper, sealer, and polish.

Maria Auxiliadora is forty-five years old and her business is selling tamales and tortillas.  Cintia is thirty-five years old and sells new clothing.  Roberto is thirty years old and his business is making and selling furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood, sandpaper, sealer, and polish.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family.  Gina is married and has a candle making business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like thread, wax, coloring powder, etc., to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like thread, wax, coloring powder, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Socorro works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Ma. Socorro is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Ma. Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
Because the price of pig feed is high, the Jaya Usaha Baluk group has requested a loan to cover its costs. Each member will receive two million Indonesian rupiah (IDR). The loan will be used to buy superior quality piglets and feed. At the time the funds are to be distributed in the field, all members will attend the meeting. 

Ni Nengah will use the loan to buy three piglets and high quality feed. Currently, to reduce costs, she gives her pigs mixed quality feeds. She hopes her new pigs will grow up healthily and not be attacked by disease. She needs this loan because she does not have enough savings to raise the pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leonarda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Leonarda is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy materials like a fishing net, paint, nails, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat for her fish business.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like a fishing net, paint, nails, bamboo, etc. for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc. Marlyn has been in this business for 14 years now. In the future, Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Barbine

texts.fr: Madame Barbine est une femme qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Elle détient un comptoir dans un marché de la place où elle vend le gombo, les pattates et quelques légumes. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa competence dans ce domaine, elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite à nouveau un prêt  pour acheter des vivres en gros, entre autres la tomate, les légumes et bien d'autres. Les bénéfices tirés de ce crédit lui permettront de fluxtifier son capital, améliorer son cadre de vie et enfin de subvenir aux differents besoins des membres de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Barbine is a woman who lives in a district in the capital. She has a table at a local market, where she sells okra, sweet potatoes, and some vegetables. Thanks to her dynamism and competence in this domain, she has earned a growing customer base that she would like to continue to satisfy. To do so, she is requesting a new loan to purchase some staple foods wholesale, including tomatoes, vegetables, and much more. The profits derived from this loan will enable her to mobilize her capital, improve her living conditions, and finally to meet the different needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs at wholesale (tomatoes, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: As a married mother of eleven children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Salvacion is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 48 years. Milagros earns additional income from a general store and also from selling pre-paid mobile phone credits. 

Milagros is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Paix De Jesus 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Duquene est le coordinateur de son groupe Paix de Jesus 1, 2 & 3. Il n est pas marie il a 3 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Il dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire pendants les 6 derniers années 

Duquene espère que ce emprunt`l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Paix de Jesus ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces tel que ventes produits cosmetiques, nourriture, boissons gazeuses, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défi principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant
texts.en:
Duquene is the coordinator of his group Paix de Jesus 1, 2 & 3. He is not married, and he has three children. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. He has been running his business selling grocery items for the last six years. 

Duquene hopes that this loan will help him to expand his commerce. Other members of Paix de Jesus have need of a loan for businesses selling products, such as cosmetics, food, soft drinks, charcoal, etc.  He says that his main challenge is to become a bigger merchant.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items (rice, flour, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Mulya Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and the members of Mulya Sari group have applied for a new loan. It will be used to purchase piglets, feed and to renovate a barn. Ni Ketut will use her share of the loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. Ni Ketut and her husband are hard workers and every day they spend their time in the garden maintaining their crops and their pigs.

The Mulya Sari members hope MUK will still support them with the loan until they have enough of their own capital to run their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase three superior piglets

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
La señora Fermina tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella y se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de golosinas como ser venta de yuca, papas, baleadas etc. las cuales vende desde su casa de habitación. 
Doña  Fermina es una mujer muy trabajadora y el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de papas, yuca, repollo, carnes, cebollas, vinagre, salsas, refrescos, azúcar, etc. para poder cubrir la demanda que tiene por parte de sus clientes.
Doña  Fermina espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo y que le permita en un futuro generar más fuentes de empleo .
Doña  Fermina su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Fermina is forty-four years old.  She lives with her husband in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa, in the center of Honduras.  She has two children who are her dependents.  For several years, she has made a living selling snacks, like yucca, french fries, stuffed tortillas, etc., from her home.

Fermina is a very hardworking woman.  With the loan, she will buy potatoes, yucca, cabbage, meat, onions, vinegar, sauces, refreshments, sugar, etc.  With these items, she will be able to meet the demand for her snacks.

Fermina hopes that the investment in her business will generate sufficient income so that she can move herself ahead with her family.  She also hopes that her business will continue to grow, allowing her to create job opportunities for others in the future.  Her dream is to see her children graduate with greater opportunities in life.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to buy potatoes, yucca, cabbage, meat, onions, vinegar, sauces, beverages, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Las Buenas Esposas Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cuatro socios luchadores y trabajadores uno de ellos es Cenelia  mujer de 36 años de edad, acompañada, su negocio es la venta de comida desde hace 1 año en la zona franca. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como es carne de res, carne de cerdo, carne de pollo, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, chiltoma, cebolla, achote, ajo, aceite. Platos, cucharas, desechables. Olivero tiene 35 años su negocio es la reparación y venta de repuesto de bicicletas, Lillian tiene 55 años su negocio es la venta de leña, frijoles cocidos y Xiomara mujer de 30 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
The group is made up of four determined and hardworking members. One of them is Cenelia, a 36-year-old married woman. For the past year, she has had a business selling food in the free trade zone. 

She requests the loan to purchase raw materials like beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, bananas, sweet peppers, onions, annatto, garlic, oil, plates, spoons, and disposable goods. 

Olivero is 35 years old and makes a living by repairing bicycles and selling spare bicycle parts. Lillian is 55 years old and sells firewood and cooked beans. Xiomara is 30 years old and sells cosmetics and clothing,

loans.use: to buy raw materials like beef, pork, chicken, rice, beans, bananas, sweet peppers, onions, annatto, garlic, oil, plates, spoons, and disposable goods.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is 50 years old and separated from her husband, with no children.  After almost 26 years of operating her Sari-sari store, Pablita has gone through ups and downs in this business. There are times that the business is weak, but Pablita still innovates to achieve her goal and never gives up, because this is the only way for her to make a living.  Her Sari-sari store is becoming succesful now due to her newly added videoke machine.  Many people drop by to sing and have a snack at her store.  Many people who just passed by before are now fascinated to drop by and buy snacks at her store.  Pablita wants to extend her Sari-sari store so she needs an estimated capital of 50,000 PHP in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy new retail supplies to sell to customers of her store.

location.town: Dipolog-Minaog, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rodylin

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rodylin works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  

Rodylin is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodylin has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Asuncion works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Asuncion is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

Asuncion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with one kid.

Helen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  Helen requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for seven years now.  She has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married. She has three children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming rice. 

Elizabeth requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, soft drinks, candies, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, soft drinks, candies, etc.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mirindi est un leader du collectif de crédit « baraka alanine », senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 41 ans et mère de 13 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un menuisier. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses produits au marché public. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le fonds additionnels du prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il ya 10 qu’elle exerce cette activité. La cliente a déjà réalisé beaucoup de petits projets pour sa famille à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les denrées alimentaires (3 sacs d’haricots,  2 sacs de farine de maïs, 1 sac de riz,  50 kg d’arachides, les légumes, aubergines, etc..). Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son entreprise et construire une jolie maison en matériaux durables. Les impayés et la vente en crédit sont des défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit dédiés aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables, pendant ce moment critique de guerre.
texts.en:
This client, Mirindi, is the leader of the loan collective "Baraka Alanine". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, 41 years old, and the mother of thirteen children, all students. Her husband is a furniture maker. This client sells grocery items. She sets up her goods at the public market. She started her business using her own funds from her husband. Later on, she benefited from additional funds borrowed from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for ten years. This client has already realized many small projects for her family by using the profits from this business. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase food supplies: 3 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of cornmeal, a sack of rice, 50 kg of peanuts, vegetables, eggplant, etc. Thus, she would like to provide education to her children, expand her enterprise, and build a nice house of sturdy material. Some business challenges she faces are customers who do not pay and selling on credit. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-loan support dedicated to small-scale entrepreneurs who are unbanked, during this critical time of war.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (beans, corn, rice, peanuts, vegetables, eggplant, etc.)

loans.name: Les Fideles Des Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Paulimus est le coordinateur de son groupe Fideles de Dilaire. Il n'est pas marie. Il a 3 enfants. Paulimus habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Paulimus dirige son commerce de vente de produits cosmetique pendants les 7 derniers années. Il espère que ce emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de Fideles de Dilaire ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces ventes produits cosmétiques, charbon, chaussures, etc. Il dit que son défi principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Paulimus is the coordinator of his group Fideles de Dilaire. He is not married, and he has three children. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. Paulimus has been running his business selling cosmetic products for the last seven years. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his commerce. 

Other members of Fideles de Dilaire have need of a loan for businesses selling products, such as cosmetics, charcoal, shoes, etc.  He says that his main challenge is to become a bigger merchant. His main goal is to have a larget business, which will facilitate the construction of a larger house with loans from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres personas  trabajadoras una de ellas Adriana mujer de 39 años, casada, con dos hijos de dependen de ella, su negocio es un taller de costura desde hace 15 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 6 años, sus dos hijas mayores y su esposo ayudan a elaborar los pantalones. El crédito lo está solicitando  para la compra de telas de gabardina, sincatex, hilos, botones, zippers, agujas. María tiene 63 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y Cándida tiene 46 años su negocio es la venta de frutas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking people. One of them is Adriana, a 39-year-old woman who is married and has two children who depend on her. For the past 15 years, her business has been a sewing workshop. She has been a client of the institution for six years. Her two sons and husband help her to make pants. 

She has requested the loan so that she can purchase material to make raincoats and uniforms, thread, buttons, zippers, and needles.

Maria is 63 years lost and sells Nicaraguan tamales. Candida is 46 years old and she makes a living by selling fruit.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make raincoats and uniforms, thread, buttons, zippers, and needles.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 51-year-old farmer.  He has been raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn, to sell.  He has been involved in this kind of business for over ten years which has developed him in to a good farmer.  However, despite his years in the business, he still aims to improve his farming practices that will contribute to the success of his yields.  

He wants to improve the growth of his crops but he has insufficient funds.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides) and to pay for labor costs for farming.  Gilbert promises to pay back his loan in full and hopes to continue improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, insecticides) and to pay for labor costs for farming

loans.name: Ariane

texts.en:
Ariane, 28  years old, owns and operates a retail business selling items such as general merchandise to earn a living. She has been in her business for four years. Her previous loan from GDMPC, which was used in her business, was successfully repaid. 

She borrowed a new loan to purchase grocery goods like canned and sachet products.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like canned goods and sachet products.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to renovate her rental apartment. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a buy and sell business where she sells pork, chicken, frozen products and rice.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to renovate her apartment and also to buy products for her buy and sell business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy ingredients for her food stall and her business keeps on growing. Her income from the business assisted in her everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Maria would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria hopes that her business will last and dreams for good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 39 years old and married. Myra is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for eleven years now and has borrowed three times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

Myra requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Sonia de 33años,  estudio hasta séptimo grado y por falta de recursos económicos, no continúo con sus estudios. Es madre soltera de una hija de 5 años, que asiste al kínder. Sonia vive junto con sus padres a los cuales les ayuda.

Ella se dedicara a la venta de ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos, lociones, ya que ella necesita tener una fuente de trabajo propia, que le permita obtener sus ingresos, para tener un estilo de vida mejor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 3 docenas de ropa para niño, 3 docenas de ropa para jóvenes entre ellos blusas, faldas, pantalones y camisas. De esta manera, dispondrá de mayor variedad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes. 

Ella a futuro desea, tener un negocio estable que le permita día a día, obtener ingresos. Así podrá ayudarle a su hija en el estudio, y también a sus padres , y a la ves tener un estilo de vida que le permita vivir en armonía con su familia
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old. She studied until Grade 7 but due to a lack of economic resources could not continue to study. She is the single mother of a 5 year old daughter who attends kindergarten. 

She sells clothing for children, youth and adults and  lotions. She needs to have a source of work of her own which allows her to make money and to live a decent lifestyle. 

The loan Sonia is requesting is to buy three dozen pieces of clothing for children and three dozen pieces for youth, including blouses, skirts, pants and shirts. In this way, she will have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her clients.

Her desire for the future is to have a stable business which would permit her to have a daily income. Then she could help her child with her studies and also help her parents. And allow them to have an agreeable lifestyle as a family.

loans.use: to buy children and youth's clothing by the dozen including blouses, skirts, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has three children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past ten years. Additionally, she raises pigs for supplementary income. She is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers. Prior to this request, Jocelyn took out and repaid six loans from NWTF. 

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customera

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is fifty years old. She is married and has five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Letecia has run a retail home products business in the Philippines for the past twenty-six years. She is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bags, hats, and home products to sell.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags, hats, and household products to sell

loans.name: Revolution De Ferrier 1, 2 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Yvrose est la coordinatrice de son groupe Revolution de ferrier. Elle est mariee elle est possede d'enfants. Yvrose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir aven duit du Charbon. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.  Yvrose a dirigé son commerce de Charbon pendant les 16 dernières années. 

Des autres membres Revolution de ferrier ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetement, chaussures, produit alimentaires, etc. Yvrose dit que ses défis principal est de venie une grande commercant. Yvrose habite dans la région de ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.
texts.en:
Yvrose is the coordinator of her group "Revolution de Ferrier". She is married and has children. She would like to use this loan to invest in charcoal products. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Yvrose has been running her charcoal business for the last sixteen years. 

Other members of the group Revolution de Ferrier have need of a loan for businesses selling products, such as charcoal, clothing, shoes, grocery items, etc. Yvrose says that her main challenges include becoming a major merchant. She lives in the Ferrier region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City.  She is 50 years old, married and has an only child. 

Narcisa manufactures and sells hand-made baskets. She has been doing this business for eight years to make a living. She sells woven products in their community and some in the market. Her previous loan from GDMPC that was used in the business was successfully repaid. 

She borrowed a new loan to buy additional rattan materials to to improve her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rattan materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a 58-year-old widow with four children who manages her own farm in Kinuman, Ozamis City in order to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her farm. Recently, she has applied for a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She always finds ways to improve her farm for the betterment of her family's life. In the future, she wants to improve their house to make a comfortable living for them.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is thankful for the financial assistance that she has received. Through a previous loan, she was able to buy products for her variety store. The loan also helped her pay for her children's education. In addition to operating a variety store, Vilma also runs a junk shop. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family's everyday expenses.

Vilma would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy scrap and recyclable materials, as well as grocery items for her variety store. Her business profits will help her sustain her family's daily needs and children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Vilma dreams that she will be able to expand her junk shop and variety store. Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. There she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed for her business

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Martha con su credikiva, que invirtió en insumos, con los que preparó ricos postres y los vendió  muy pronto.  Con este financiamiento, movilizó aun más clientela y ahora han solicitado que dirija su negocio a la venta de comidas, con lo que hoy, está obteniendo nuevos ingresos, y ha logrado mejorar su vivienda. Ella dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por el préstamo, que me ha beneficiado mucho, espero me sigan apoyando.” En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará, insumos como arroz, aceite, lácteos, azucare, grasas, etc. para aumentar la  producción de comidas y postres, aprovechando que se acerca la época de fin de año y con ello sus ventas se impactarán aun más. La inversión de su credikiva es exitosa, en tanto a que la realiza mientras recoge el dinero de sus cuentas por cobrar y da respuesta inmediata a su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Martha with her Kiva loan, which she invested in supplies, which she used to prepare delicious desserts that sold quite quickly. With this funding, she mobilized even more clients, and she has now been asked to direct her business to food sales. Through this, she is now obtaining new sources of income, and has been able to make improvements to her home. 

To her lenders, she says, "Thank you for the loan, which has been very beneficial for me. I hope that you continue to support me." She is now applying for a new Kiva loan, which she will use to buy supplies such as rice, oil, dairy products, sugars, fats, etc. to increase her production of foods and desserts, taking advantage of the fact that the year is coming to an end and her sales will be even more greatly affected. The investment of her Kiva loan is successful, in that it comes while she is collecting money from her accounts receivable and giving immediate response to her demanding clientele.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil, dairy products, sugars, and fats.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha works hard to support her family.  Martha is single and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Martha requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of shirts, pants, hats, blouses, etc., to sell.

Martha has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Martha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shirts, pants, hats, blouses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, who is 52 years old, is married, with four children, two of them in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional clothes, zippers, and other materials for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes, zippers, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng, age 54, is a married woman who has four children. They happily live in their own house located in the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. 

She cultivates the land for growing rice, which is the sole source of her family’s income to provide meals, education, and basic services for her family. She has been in this field for more than 30 years with the full support from her husband and children.

As of now she needs a loan to start a new business of selling steamed buns in a public gathering area. With this loan amount, she will buy an inox box -- a warming box in which she can place a clay stone to warm her steamed buns for sale. This will be a great help to enable her in her new business. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an inox box -- a warming box in which she can place a clay stone to warm her steamed buns for sale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 52 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosalina has been in the pig fattening business for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Rosalina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 29 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают одну дочь. Анара работает юристом, супруг работает в своей же вулканизации. В 2010 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле шинами для автомашин с арендованной вулканизации, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 150,000 сом (KGS) закупив полностью оборудование. Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Анара имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли выкупить вулканизацию, которую раньше арендовали. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки шин для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на покупку жилья.
texts.en:
Anara is 29 years old. Together with her husband she raises a daughter. Anara works as a lawyer, and her husband works with vulcanization. 

In 2010, the couple started a business of selling car tires made more durable through vulcanization with rented equipment. They used an amount of 150,000 som (KGS) as a start-up capital. After having managed to develop the business and to find returning customers, Anara had an average income of 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work with the business, the couple managed to purchase the vulcanizing equipment they had previously rented. 

With an aim to further improve and develop her business, Anara turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase tires wholesale to subsequently sell. Anara plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the working capital and save money for buying a house.

loans.use: to purchase tires for resale

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan is getting a new loan of 7M IDR, which he will use to buy piglets and fix his car. 

Pig rearing has been shown to increase the family's income. Now he needs to save for his children's education. The condition of the car also needs to be maintained to provide comfort to the passengers. 

I Wayan periodically brings his car to the garage for repair. He hopes the results obtained can be maximized, his children can study until university and their future will be bright.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and also maintain his car.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, piñas, guineos, manzanas,  tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas,  entre otros tiene 3 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; él es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. El cliente  tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, está agradecido con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
This member lives in his own house together with his wife and his two daughters. He sells fruits and vegetables – strawberries, plantains, oranges, pineapples, bananas, apples, tomatoes, onions, peppers, potatoes, etc. He has been running this business for three years and acquired a lot of experience which allows him to improve his profits. His place of business is strategically located for this activity and very busy. He already has a large clientele that prefers him because of his fresh products, good prices, good quality, and excellent service. 

He is an enterprising man, dedicated to his business, and with a great desire to progress. He is always looking for alternatives that will help him to succeed. In the last couple of weeks the demand has risen and he wants to take the opportunity to make a new investment, however, he doesn't possess enough capital. That is why he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral that will allow him to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. The member has good references from his neighbors. He is grateful for the support and pledges to pay back his loan. He believes that it will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLLILAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario ella es casada y tiene 32 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of a communal bank called "Los Comerciantes de Andahuayllilas".  This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.  

The featured member is Rosario.  She is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. She works in the business of raising and selling animals. She raises the guinea pigs and hens, fattens them, and later sells them at different fairs. Through this small business, she supports her children.  Her dream is to have her own location where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase guinea pigs and hens, and provide food for them. 

The members who are featured in the group photo took the photo after a group meeting where they were asking for a work permit. The other members work selling a corn beverage called chicha, raising animals, a grocery business, and a retail business selling food. 
 
Rosario is grateful to those who are part of this dream, and is committed to complying with the payments and fees by the deadlines.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and to provide food for them.

loans.name: Lorgenia

texts.en:
Lorgenia is 54 and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail store for a living. Aside from this, she also has a farm of coconut, which she harvests and sells in town. 

Lorgenia joined GDMPC in 2010 and she has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used in her retail store business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for the coconut farm. 

In the future, Lorgenia wants to be successful in her business and able to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her coconut farm.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl, 29 years old, is a married woman from Alcala. She is striving hard to gain a profitable business through farming and a catering services business. She is very determined and that is why her spouse supports her goals in life too. Cheryl usually gains about PHP 25,000 each harvest season, which is twice a year. 

Cheryl aspires for better income that is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides to use in farming. In addition, she will also pay for laborers and buy supplies used in her catering services business. As a responsible borrower, she will pay back her loan in full. 

Cheryl hopes to obtain an abundant harvest every crop season so she can provide her family with a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to use in farming.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is very thankful for the financial assistance that has been extended to her as it has enabled her to buy products needed for her printing business. Her loan has also been helpful for the education of her children, while income from her business assisted with her family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their family.

Jocelyn would like to apply for another 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan to buy greater quantities of raw materials for her business like paint, screens, and shirts. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this increased income with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like paint, screens, and shirts for her printing business.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 39 years old, married and has two children.

Jacquelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Jacquelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jacquelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and she  earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell for her business.

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une femme de 45 ans mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomate, patates, macabo, maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 17 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des régimes de plantains et des cajots de tomate pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marguerite is a 45-year-old mother. She is a merchant, and for 17 years, she's been selling seasonal fresh food (tomatoes, potatoes, cocoyams, cassavas, plantains, palm nuts, and fruit) at retail prices in a local market. 

She knows her suppliers well, and knows her clientele especially well. She has acquired clients over time due to her experience in the field. 

She is constantly facing stock shortages due to her limited capital. She must sell all of her supplies in order to replenish her stock.

She would like to buy bunches of bananas and crates of tomatoes to have enough stock to allow her to better satisfy the constant demand of her clients and to avoid stock shortages.

She will save her profits not only to grow her business, but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of plantains and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Don Fredy vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y frijol con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas herbicidas, etc. así como  muestra la fotografía, pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: Fredy lives in his own home with his wife and three children. For many years, he has made a living in agriculture, which is his primary source of income. He plants corn and beans and with the money he earns from his crops, he is able to pay his household expenses. He wants to buy the necessary supplies for his crops such as manure, fertilizers, herbicide seeds, and other products as seen in the photo. However, because he doesn't have the economic resource he needs for this investment, he decided to request a loan so he can keep farming. Along with all farmers, he puts his confidence in agriculture because he doesn't have other sources of income and wants to succeed by doing the best he can with his crops. He hopes to have an abundant crop that will allow him to keep providing for his family every day and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicide seeds, and other products.

loans.name: Ven
