In the future, Bernardita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Romy Sarely

texts.es:
Romy es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Romy se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Romy trabaja como auxiliar en un estudio contable de su ciudad,ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Romy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada compra prendas de vestir de damas para su venta, de esta manera iniciará su negocio de venta de ropa, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Romy is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa together with her parents and siblings. She is hard-working, enthusiastic, and has a great drive to succeed. Romy is studying accounting thanks to her effort and to the help of her parents. She works on her own initiative as an accounting assistant in her city. She works every day for around 10 hours, and she believes that it is going well because of her dedication and her good performance.

Romy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because their help allows her to buy women's clothes so that she can start a business selling clothes. She will continue working and struggling to achieve her dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 44-year-old married man. He is the father of 3 sons and 3 daughters. 
He is a very energetic, honest, and hardworking man. He performs all his duties regarding milk, yogurt, and butter selling very well. He gets fresh milk from a wholesaler for reselling as a retailer. He uses part of the unsold milk for making yogurt, butter, and cheese and for his family usage. 

He is responsible for his children and sibling as well. His younger sister has been reaching the age of marriage. He has to arrange the dowry for her so that she can find respect in her husband’s house. He wants to grow his business to cope with the inflation and gather dowry for his sister.
 
Therefore, Ashraf requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more milk to get more income. Ashraf hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the lives of his beloved family members. He wants to perform his duties well regarding his sibling. 

Ashraf says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk for reselling and producing yogurt and butter to sell.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris works hard to support her child. She is married and has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.

Mary Cris requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her child with bright light when they study at night.

Mary Cris is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Baby Aluora

texts.en:
Baby Aluora is 25 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Baby Aluora has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years, and earns an income from direct selling of Avon and MSE products.

Baby Aluora aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old and married.

Arlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlyn has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ashiq

texts.en:
Ashiq is a 41-year-old married man. He is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His family consists of three children and a wife. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible woman and fulfills her household duties efficiently. 

Since 1992, Ashiq has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. He has two buffaloes for this work. He sells their milk door to door and in the main market. By doing so, he generates income for fulfilling his family's needs. His current net income is not enough to cope with the daily and monthly needs of his family. He has lots and lots of expenses to pay for, such as electricity bills, gas and water bills, the children’s school fees, food expenses and also the buffaloes’ upkeep and their food expenses. So, he is planning to purchase one more buffalo to increase his selling.

Currently, he is interested in purchasing one more buffalo to grow his business, but he finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Ashiq has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. He will use the loan amount to purchase a buffalo. This will not only help him to increase his milk selling, but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture, Ashiq is standing with one of his buffaloes at the farm where he keeps the buffaloes.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo in order to increase his milk sales.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
El Señor Arsenio, es carpintero, fabrica todo tipo de variedad de muebles para el hogar, comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 10 año, es muy emprendedor  y día a día lucha para salir adelante.
Vive con su esposa y un hijo menor en su propia casa que pudo tener gracias a su trabajo. El señor es muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación tiene  un trabajo independiente. Tiene por objetivo mantener  y fortalecer su carpintería, por esta razón ha recurrido a la fundación y agradece por la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas, clavos, tornillos y demás, que va a utilizar en su taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Arsenio is a carpenter, he builds a wide variety of furniture for the home.  He comments that he has been working in this field for more than 10 years, is very enterprising and each day he fights to get ahead.

He lives with his wife and young son in their own house that he was able to get thanks to his job.  He is very hardworking, with a lot of effort and dedication he works independently. He has a goal to maintain and strengthen his carpentry business.  For this reason, he has returned to the foundation and is thankful for the opportunity to obtain this loan.

He requests this loan to be able to invest in buying wood, nails, screws and more, that he will use in his carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, screws and more.

loans.name: Carmen Eloina

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra formada por hermosos pasajes, su centro histórico guarda celosamente la historia de la ciudad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años que están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor y futuro para su familia, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Carmen desde hace 3 años labora en un bar de un colegio donde vende una gran variedad de productos, labora de lunes a viernes. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra sodas, jugos, frutas, papas fritas, galletas, etc. para incrementar en su bar. Su meta es de crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is making her first loan request along with her friends and colleagues from the Futuro para un Bienestar loan group. She lives in Cuenca, a city with beautiful countryside, and its historic center jealously guards the city's history. Its people still uphold the culture and traditions of its cities. 

Carmen is 36 years old, she is married and has two children aged 12 and 15 as a result of her partnership, who are studying at a secondary school in the city. Her husband moved away to seek a better future for his family. Carmen doesn't have her own home which is why she rents. 

For the last three years, Carmen has been working in a college pub where she sells a variety of products. She works from Monday to Friday. Carmen will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of fizzy drinks, fruit juices, chips, biscuits and so on to stock her bar. Her aim is to grow more in the business.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, fruice juice, fruit, chips, biscuits and so on.

loans.name: Chaleta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Chaleta works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vending vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Chaleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is very thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her, as she was able to buy the gardening materials needed in her business. Her income from business also helped in their everyday household expenses.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy gardening materials including wire, baskets, seed and fertilizer. Her business profits will definitely help sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lolita hopes that her plants will grow beautiful and more customers will purchase them. As a CCT community partner, she attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
This is Teodora, who previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Teodora would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teodora dreams that her business will expand and endure. She hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est un jeune de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Détenteur d’un permis, il a décidé de se lancer dans le transport spécialement dans celui de moto taxi. Seulement, il n’a pas les moyens de s’offrir une moto-Jakarta c’est pourquoi il fait recourt a l’IMCEC pour en acheter une. Cheikh vit chez ses parents et participe a la dépense quotidienne. Les moto taxis sont un moyen de transport très utilisé dans cette partie du pays a cause de la facilité et de la rapidité. 
Cheikh est à ses débuts, mais il a comme ambition d’acheter dans l’avenir 2 autres motos pour le donner à ses frères qui sont actuellement sans travail.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a young man, 25 years old, unmarried, and without children. Possessing a permit, he decided to get started in transportation, especially in motorbike taxi services. He just lacks the means to provide services with a Jakarta motorbike. This is why he is turning toward IMCEC to purchase one. Cheikh lives with his parents and helps to cover day-to-day expenses. Moto-taxis are a highly used transportation method in this part of the country for its ease and speed. 

Cheikh is just starting off. But has the ambition to purchase two other motorbikes in the future to give to his brothers, who are currently unemployed.

loans.use: to purchase a Jakarta motorbike for his transport business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, a widow with a tailoring business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In this business for 14 years now, she is requesting a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as clothes, tape measures, etc.

Florita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like clothes, tape measures, etc

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 8 femmes fait partie d'un banc villageois qui a été créé le 21 Mars 2001. Elles sont solidairement liés et exercent le petit commerce en général. Madame Arame qui est à la droite de la photo est la représentante. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre garçons et de deux filles. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons séchés et d’huîtres séchées depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt 100 kg de poissons séchés et de 40 kg d’huîtres. Les bénéfices serviront a participer à la dépense quotidienne et à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group of eight women is part of a 'banc villageois' that was created on March 21, 2001. The women are joined in solidarity and work in small-scale commerce in general. Ms. Arame, who is at the right in the photo, is the group's representative. She is a married mother of four boys and two girls. She is 48 years old and has been active in selling dried fish and dried oysters for several years. She is going to purchase 100 kg of dried fish and 40 kg of oysters. The profits will be used to help cover day-to-day expenses and the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and 'yets' (dried shellfish)

loans.name: Waliou Olakorédé

texts.fr: Waliou Olakorédé âgé de 58 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Moudjibath. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Waliou Olakorédé a très peu fréquenté l'école. Waliou Olakorédé vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Depuis quatorze ans, Waliou Olakorédé est meunier. Cette activité lui permet de faire face à ses besoins et d'assurer les charges de sa famille. Dans le but de renforcer son activité par l'achat de pièces de rechange, Waliou Olakorédé sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Waliou Olakorédé, aged 58, is married to a merchant named Moudjibath. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Waliou Olakorédé has had little schooling. He lives with his wife and children. The household expenses are covered by the couple. For fourteen years, he has been making furniture. This business enables him to meet his needs and to ensure the family expenses are covered. With the goal of bolstering his business by purchasing spare parts, Waliou Olakorédé is requesting financial support from ALIDé for a sixth time. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna and her spouse are farmers within their village. They plant and harvest corn to sell. Aside from farming, Myrna is also selling vegetables to add to their family income. Income generated from vegetable vending goes for meals, bills at home and the education expenses of her child who is attending college.

Myrna wanted to avail a loan in order to improve the growth of her corn crop production. She will use her requested loan amount of PHP 15,000 for buying fertilizers and insecticides necessary to maintain good crop growth. In this way, she could obtain a plentiful harvest. She promises to fully pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 37 years old and married. Paulina has four children who are in school.

Paulina is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Paulina requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vaccines and additional cattle for her business.

Paulina has been raising cattle for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and additional cattle for her business

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle service business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle service business. Ma. Flor has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

Ma. Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.


Laura requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like needles, thread, buttons, etc.


In the future, Laura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like needles, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Cheremy

texts.en:
Cheremy is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Cheremy has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Cheremy has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cheremy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna  is 48 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. Lorna  is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy an additional goat to raise.  Lorna  has been raising goats for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional goat to raise.

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia is 41 years old and has six children. Melicia is married and has one child who is still in school.  Melicia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melicia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maribel is 39 years old and her children are in school.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Elizabeth lives with her family in the town of CPG, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, flour, sugar and cooking materials. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store.

In the future, Elizabeth wants to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, like food and the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, flour, sugar and cooking materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ishfaq

texts.en:
Mr. Ishfaq is 45 years old. He lives in Pakistan with his wife, three sons and three daughters. He is an excellent cook. He owns a food stall in the market, the only source of income for the family. He sells tasty and delicious food like fried rice, mixed vegetables, beef etc. His customers love the food he offers. His income is too low to cover their household expenses.

Presently, he is in need of purchasing oil, eggs, pulses (lentils), beef, rice and variety of vegetables for preparing food. For that reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed food items for his stall.

With the profit he will first pay back the loan. Mr. Ishfaq dream is to provide the best and quality education to his children. He wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: To purchase oil, eggs, pulses (lentils), beef, rice and a variety of vegetables for preparing food

loans.name: Fridoline Norbertine

texts.fr: Fridoline est une femme de 50 ans sans enfant, ayant sa mère à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate et légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de cajots de tomate pour  mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fridoline is a 50-year-old woman and has no children. Supporting her mother, she is a merchant and has been selling fresh staple foods retail (tomatoes and vegetables) according to the season for sixteen years at a local market. She is very familiar with suppliers and especially her customers, whom she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell her entire inventory before being able to acquire more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to increase her inventory of crates of tomatoes to do better in satisfying the constant demand from her customers and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Kutogwa Group

texts.en:
Athumani, who is in his early sixties, is married and has two children. He is also taking care of his two relative's kids. One of his children is in school. For three years now, Athumani has been running a retail shop selling items like sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, salt, airtime and others. He works from 6am to 9pm per working day and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this to replace the shop items sold. Athumani dreams to own a wholesale shop. He will share this loan with his loan group " KUTOGWA" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop items to replace those sold.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Feliciana tiene 56 años, tiene dos hijas mayores, ya ninguna de ellas depende de Feliciana. Ella se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas, verduras y ropa desde hace más de 12 años.
Empezó con un pequeño capital propio vendiendo frutas y verduras en su barrio en forma ambulante, después de unos años y gracias al capital ahorrado pudo fijar local comercial en su casa. Después de varios años y en vista a que le fue bien se animó a invertir más en su negocio y fue así que se acercó a la fundación paraguaya para solicitar su primer crédito, y desde hace 5 años que trabaja con la institución.
Ella hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra Blusa para dama, camisas para caballero, vaquero para damas y caballeros,  frutas de estación como naranja, pomelo, y verduras como tomate, cebolla, papa, lechuga, etc., con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por crecer en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 56, has two older daughters; neither is dependent on Feliciana. Feliciana has been buying and selling fruits, vegetables and clothing for more than 12 years.

She began with her own small equity capital selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor in her area. After some years, and through the funds saved, she was able to get a fixed commercial place in her house. After several years, and considering it went well, she was encouraged to invest more in her business and thus she approached the Fundación Paraguaya to request her first loan. It's been 5 years she has been working with the institution.

Today she is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of women's blouses, men's shirts, jeans for women and men, seasonal fruits such as oranges and grapefruit as well as vegetables like tomato, onion, potato, lettuce etc... With this loan she will be able to continue working and fighting to grow her small business.

loans.use: to purchase women's blouses, men's shirts, jeans for women and men, seasonal fruits such as oranges and grapefruit as well as vegetables like tomato, onion, potato, lettuce etc...

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc,. for her manicure/pedicure business.  Lolita has been in this business for 20 years.    She earns additional income from a general store.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc., for her business

loans.name: Zafar Ullah

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture is named Zafar Ullah. He is 53 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for 25 years, and the business is operating very well. His shop is situated under a populated area and a lot of customers are available here to offer miscellaneous general store items. 

Zafar Ullah does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam, a few stationery items, soft drinks and ice cream. But he does not have arefrigerator to keep ice cream and jam fresh.

Therefore, Zafar Ullah requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy additional item such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks and ice cream. Zafar Ullah is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. 

Zafar Ullah is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and he assures that he will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: To buy additional items such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks and ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder for his family to use for cooking

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She describes her biggest family challenge as the lack of enough storage facilities. Rebecca will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. The family will be able to store clean water for domestic use. 

Rebecca hopes that in the future, she will sustain the family economically. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans for KES 20,000 and 40,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Santos Ynocente

texts.es:
Santos Ynocente tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Mocupe-lagunas que se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Se dedica desde hace más de 12 años a la elaboración y venta de pan y bizcochos en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de S/.4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de una moto carguera con la que podrá movilizar su mercadería más rápido, lo que le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Ynocente, 52, lives in Mocupe-Iagunas with his wife and son.  The town is in a rural area of Chiclayo, a province in the Lambayeque region along Peru's northern coast.

Santos Ynocente has a bread-making and bizcochos business, a business that he has operated from his house for 12 years.  He is applying for a S/.4,000 new soles loan to buy a moto-cart that he will use to carry his goods to market faster.  The investment will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a moto-cart for his bakery business.

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
This is Ma. Consuelo. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Ma. Consuelo would like to apply for another loan of 40,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Consuelo dreams that her store will be bigger, and that it will become a grocery store. She hopes that she will have the strength to do everything that she has to do. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 51 years old and married with one child.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like cotton, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, bread and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from retailing electronic mobile load.

Thelma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like cotton, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, bread and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock like chickens, goats, and pigs to sell.

Susan has been in this business for six years now.

Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock like chickens, goats, and pigs to sell

loans.name: Mujahid

texts.en:
Mujahid lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is 28 years old and married, and he lives with his wife and one daughter. 

For many years, Mujahid worked at a furniture workshop in a furniture factory. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in manufacturing furniture during his time in the furniture factory. In 2010, he began his own business in the main market. Now he has a small workshop of his own where he takes orders, mainly making kitchen and restroom furniture. 

His workshop is very well known not only in his community market, but also in nearby area markets. That is why he has many loyal clients who want to order their desired style of furniture specifically from his workshop. 

Currently, he has many orders and he must fill them on time. However, he lacks materials, which makes his work slow and not productive.

Mujahid asks for a Kiva loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan in order to buy a lot of raw materials for his work. As a result, he will be able to successfully continue his work and raise his living standard.

The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a lot of raw materials for his work.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 45-year old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from CPG, Bohol. She runs a retail store selling various goods like food. This is her source of income.

Helen is asking for a loan to buy rice, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Helen hopes of making her business a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy rice, biscuits and snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, milk, juice, detergent soap and other items to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for six years. Rosalie earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, diapers, milk, juice, detergent soap and other items to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 23 años de edad vive junto a su hija en la casa de sus padres en una comunidad Rural de Barrios Altos Santa Rosa Baja, Cayalti dedicada al comercio de animales menores y a la agricultura a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo que se encuentra ubicada en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes y aves de corral, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2,000 nuevos soles para inversión en compra de los mismos y arreglos de jaulas que le permitirán mejorar su distribución y espacio. En la foto se muestra orgullosa con su negocio y su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Juanita, 23, lives in Barrios Altos Santa Rosa Baja Cayalti with her parents and daughter.  The town is in a rural area of Chiclayo, a province in the Lambayeque region along Peru's northern coast.  

Juanita makes a living raising and selling guinea pigs and poultry.  She is applying for a S/.2,000 new soles loan to buy animals and new cages for the business.  In the photo, Juanita is proudly showing off both her daughter and her business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for animal sales business.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 52 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.  

Marylou is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marylou requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marylou has been raising pigs for 23 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marylou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 49 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Luz aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.fr: Valerie est une femme de 60 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 18 et 35 ans, deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle a 5 autres personnes à sa charge .Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 20 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Valerie is a 60-year-old woman who is a married mother of four children, from 18 to 35 years old. Two of her children are still in school. She has five other persons to support. Valerie has been a merchant for twenty years and sells fresh staple foods retail (cassava, plantains) at a local market according to the season. She is very familiar with suppliers and especially her customers, whom she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain.  

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell her entire inventory before being able to acquire more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to purchase a truck-load of plantains to have a good stock enabling her to do better in satisfying the constant demand from her customers and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase plantains to sell

loans.name: Bunju B Group

texts.en:
Prosista, who is in her late 20s, is single with a boy who is still young. For six years now, Prosista has been running a wholesale shop selling drinks like beers, sodas, juices and waters. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good return per month. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more drinks missing from her business. She dreams to open another successfully business. Prosista will share this loan with her loan group "BUNJU B," which totals 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more drinks missing from her business

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
Jelisa is a married woman and a mother of two children from CPG, Bohol. Jelisa operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Jelisa is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, milk and sugar, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the stocks in her store thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Jelisa hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, milk and sugar, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Shekha, who is in his late 20s, is single. For three years now, Shekha has been running several businesses: a barber shop and a shop selling mobile accessories. He works from 6:00am to 10:00pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, he managed to buy phone accessories and opened his barbershop. With the business profit received, he covered household expenses, reinvested back to the business, and saved the remains. Shekha will use this loan to repair his business premises to look attractive. He dreams that one day he will be able to build a house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "MAVUNO" which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair his business premises to look attractive.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos menores en el Distrito de Oyotun donde su población se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura y ganadería que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región de Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Su familia es unida y se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte (mototaxi) y realiza labores agrícolas en la misma zona.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 4,000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa con los que espera brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Antonio, 51, lives with his wife and children in Oyotun, a rural district largely dedicated to agriculture and animal-rearing.  The district is in Chiclayo, a province in the Lambayeque region along Peru's northern coast.

Antonio's family is united in their effort to improve their lot in life.  They raise and sell pigs and other farm animals that they keep in a yard behind their house. Antonio earns extra income from a taxi (moto-taxi) business and agricultural work.

Antonio is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a S./4,000 new soles that he will use to pay for maintenance for his moto-taxi.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Joyce works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice grains. Joyce is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosana is 37 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Rosana has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Rosana has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is a farmer from the town of Alicia, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Constancia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Constancia hopes to make her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Cintya Aymee

texts.es:
Cintya Aymee tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su menor hija en el Caserío Las Delicias una zona rural del Distrito de Oyotun, donde su población realiza las actividades de comercio de animales menores y agricultura, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su esposo trabaja en la tabacalera, además presta servicios como chofer, Cintya ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de animales lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cintya Aymee, 26, lives in the Oyotun district with her young daughter.  The main sources of income for people in the district are agriculture and animal-rearing.  The district is about two hours from the city of Chiclayo and part of the Lambayeque region along Peru's northern coast.

Cintya earns an income raising and selling farm animals.  Her husband works in a local tobacco factory and earns an extra income driving a taxi.  Cintya is applying for a S./2,000 new soles loan that she will use to buy animals that she expects to sell for a profit and, in turn, bring in more income for supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Ma. Venus

texts.en:
Maria Venus is 44 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Venus is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Venus has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 55 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Verginia is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Verginia requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Verginia has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Shabir

texts.en:
Shabir has been selling sanitary goods such as water taps, fountains, sinks, joints, water pipes, elbows, showers, and related goods for many years and earning healthy income. He wants to provide all facilities and higher education to his children. He wants to prove himself a good husband and a good father.

Shabir has only one source of income, which is his sanitary shop. Earlier he was busy in another business selling construction goods, which generated low  business. He established a new business and hopes that this business will prove more beneficial than last one. He has retained a list of good customers in a short time, so this business is going well. 

Shabir wants to make a further investment to complete the remaining inventories for his newly started business, but he does not have enough capital to spend. Therefore, he has requested a loan so that he can buy the remaining stock needed for his sanitary shop. 

Shabir thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sanitary goods to sell.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is 55 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ceferina is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Ceferina has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario, está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas están mejorando bastante, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo siempre.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena, ella tiene un Kiosko en su casa  y  el crédito lo pide para la compra de insumos para volver a surtir su negocio, como ser galletitas, jugos, gaseosas, caramelos, yerba y demás. Gracias a su negocio es que día a día tiene que llevar a la mesa de su familia.
Se debe destacar la lucha que siempre hace, y que tiene muy buena predisposición.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Virgen del Rosario."  They are taking the poverty elimination survey, where they are seeing substantial improvement.  Each one of these members is putting forth her maximum effort.

One of the members of this group is Lorena.  She has a kiosk in her house, and she is requesting a loan to buy supplies to restock her business, such as cookies, juices, soft drinks, caramels, yerba tea, and other products.  Thanks to her business, she is putting food on the table each day for her family.  It should be noted that she is always very tenacious, and has a good work attitude.

loans.use: to buy cookies, juices, soft drinks, caramels, yerba tea, and other products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. She has engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 18 years. This is the source of their income.

Maribel is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Maribel hopes to make their fishing business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the needed products and grocery items for her variety store. Her store has been running for ten years now and it continues to grow. Her income from the business helped in their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margarita hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to be able to help her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Angelica Teresa

texts.es:
Angélica Teresa tiene 43 años de edad es una madre soltera, sin carga familiar vive en el Caserío Las Delicias una zona rural del Distrito de Oyotun donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la la Región de Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Se esfuerza y es conocida por la labor que realiza venta de comida preparada tallarines con pollo, papa a la huancaína, entre otros además se dedica a la venta de chileno por kilos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglos de su domicilio que le permiten tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Angelica Teresa, 43, is a single mother.  She lives in the tiny town of Las Delicias, a rural area in Oyotun district.  The main sources of income for people in the district are agriculture and other small businesses.  The district is about two hours from the city of Chiclayo and is part of the Lambayeque region along Peru's northern coast.

Angelica works hard and is known for her food business.  She makes and sells pasta with chicken, Huancaina-style potatoes and other local dishes.  She also sells wholesale supply of "chileno".  Angelica is applying for a S./ 2,500 new soles loan that she will use to pay for repairs to her house, an investment that will help to give her a decent place to live.

loans.use: to make house repairs.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store from her last loan. Her business has been running for ten years now and it keeps on growing. Her income from the business is a big help in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Crisanta dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lourdes Gen

texts.en:
Lourdes Gen is 32 years old and married with three children. With all of her children in school, Lourdes Gen works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes Gen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell there.

Lourdes Gen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, seasonings, canned goods, vinegar, bath soap, laundry soap and more. 

In the future, Lourdes Gen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her family. Concepcion is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Concepcion has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like cotton, canned goods, fabric conditioner, shampoo, cooking oil and other groceries to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for 20 years.

Concepcion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like cotton, canned goods, fabric conditioner, shampoo, cooking oil and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Saydamir

texts.ru: Сайдамиру 61 год. Он является жителем города Куляб и водителем белого миниавтобуса. В простонародье этот миниавтобус называют "Тангем", он имеет 7 пассажирских мест. Сайдамир водит "Тангем" более 7 лет. Такие миниавтобусы не долгосрочны, первая причина в том, что это пассажирская машина и вторая в том, что быстро изнашивается. Сайдамир просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свой миниавтобус. Для новой машины у него нет денег, а ремонт машины является дешевле. Сайдамир планирует отремонтировать машину и вернуться к работе. Тогда он надеется собрать средства и купить новую машину.
texts.en: Saydamir is 61 years old. He resides in Kulob and drives a white minibus. Everybody calls this minibus "Tango," and it has room for seven passengers. Saydamir has driven "Tango" for more than seven years. Such minibuses are not durable, first because it is a passenger vehicle, and second they quickly wear down. Saydamir is asking for credit to repair his minibus. He does not have enough money for a new vehicle, but repairs of his vehicle are cheaper. Saydamir is planning to repair his vehicle and return to work. Then he hopes to raise funds and buy a new car.

loans.use: for minibus repairs

loans.name: Odicar

texts.en:
Odicar is married. To supplement her husband's income and earn a living, she runs a retail business selling beauty products and cosmetics in the community. Her husband works for the government as PNP (Philippine National Police). 

Odicar has been selling beauty products for more than two years, and she gains more costumers interested to her business. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC, which she joined recently, to purchase additional cosmetics goods to resell. She wants to save an extra amount from her profit for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics goods to resell

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is 30 years old, a farmer, housewife, and mother of two unmarried children who live with her and her husband in Bakan district, Pursat province. They raise and educate their children with farming activities, growing and harvesting rice to sell in her region. Having been in the business for years, they are able to generate enough to provide for their children’s basic needs.
 
As of now, Sarim would like to help her family to be healthy and improve their living conditions, so she has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollars to build a latrine and buy some accessories. This will increase the value of her house and maintain their health in good conditions.  She is very grateful for the loan granted through Kiva via its partner, HKL, which provided clients with much lower interest rate that its general products.

loans.use: to buy a latrine for her household in order to maintain their health in good conditions.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El sr. Emilio tiene 63 años y está casado con la Sra. Salvadora de 56 años, ellos tienen 4 hijos, dos están casados y tienen sus respectivas familias, los otros dos están realizando sus estudios universitarios y trabajan con el padre en la Aguatería que tienen desde hace varios años.
El sr. Emilio tiene la Aguatería desde el año 1995, comenta que es uno de los pioneros de la zona, tenía 800 usuarios cuando empezó a trabajar con la Fundación, actualmente tiene 1000 usuarios en diferentes Barrios. Gracias a su trabajo ha ayudado a su familia, dándoles todo lo que necesitan, también por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su comunidad, proveyéndoles del líquido vital que es el agua.
El pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en mantenimiento de la red de distribución y cambio de caños averiados, con los que podrá seguir dando agua a sus vecinos y también seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio is 63 years old and married to Salvadora, aged 56. They have four children whereof two are married and have families of their own. The other two are studying at university and work together with their father in a water distribution business that they have been running for several years. 

Emilio has been running this business since 1995, and he says that he was one of the pioneers in the neighborhood. He had 800 clients when he started working with this institution, and now he has 1,000 clients in different neighborhoods. Thanks to this job he has been able to help his family and give them everything they need. In addition, he has been able to help the people of his community by providing them with this vital fluid. 

He is requesting a loan in order to maintain his distribution network and to replace damaged faucets so that he can continue providing his neighbors with water and helping his family.

loans.use: to maintain the distribution network and to replace damaged faucets

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
This is Loida. She previously accessed a 25,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Loida would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Loida hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams of helping her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income from business helped in her family's everyday expenses at home. She and her partner work hard to provide for their everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of giving her family a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. The fellowship group is also a place she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Abid

texts.en:
Abid is a 30-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan with his wife and daughter. Since 2009, Sharif has been in the business of selling milk, the only source of income for the family. He has three buffalo for his milk-selling business. He delivers milk in the market and door to door. For delivery purposes, he uses his bicycle. He loads milk cans on his bicycle and delivers them early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs.

Therefore, he planned to purchase one more buffalo to increase his sales. However, he finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Abid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to increase sales. but it will also increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. The borrower is a very hardworking and responsible person. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo to produce and sell milk.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Susan is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of supplies like sanitary napkins, canned goods, cooking oil, soy sauce, cream, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of supplies like sanitary napkins, canned goods, cooking oil, soy sauce, cream, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 37 years old and married with five children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Lilibeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
This is Erminda. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy products like candies, pepper, and others needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy products like candies, pepper, and others needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erminda dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like candies, pepper, and others needed in her business.

loans.name: Shoukat Ali

texts.en:
Shoukat is a 45-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 1992, Shoukat has been running a clock shop, the only source of income for the family. 

He purchases a variety of wall clocks from factories and sells them in the market. By doing so, he generates income to fulfill his family's needs. His net income is not enough to cope up with the daily and monthly needs of his family. He belongs to a poor family and has to pay for all of their expenses alone. 

He has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a large variety of wall clocks to sell in the main market. This will help him to increase his sales and net income. 

He is very experienced in his business, and confident that his business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of wall clocks to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has six children. Leonida has worked with her husband on their farm for over 5 years. This is their source of income.
Leonida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus increasing her harvest and yield. In the future, Leonida hopes to make her farming business a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en: Raymunda is married with seven children and manages a sari sari store in the village of Dipolog City. She has been in this business for 10 years to supplement her husband's income. She joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business and be able to provide for her family's needs. In the future, she wants to have a grocery store in the village with a complete grocery selection to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

Lucia has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Esperanza está en el 1º ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no, tienen como proyecto emprender una actividad para poder así ir aumentando sus ingresos. 
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Dionicia es dueña de una Peluquería en su casa, y el crédito que pide lo quiere utilizar para la compra de insumos para la misma, como ser tintes, tijeras, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, etc.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, un total ejemplo de lucha, y no cabe duda de que lograra su objetivo si se sigue esforzando de esa manera.
texts.en:
The group Esperanza is in its first cycle of the women entrepreneurs program where they all work and help each other to come out ahead. The majority of the members have productive activities and the others have as an undertaking project an activity to be able to be increasing their income. 

Dionicia, one of the members, is the owner of a hair salon in her house. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of supplies such as dyes, scissors, creams, shampoo, rinses etc... She is a very hard working person, a perfect example of a fighter, and there is no doubt that she will achieve her goal if she continues striving in this way.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, scissors, creams, shampoo, rinses etc...

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el caserío de Salitre una zona rural del distrito de San Felipe donde su población se dedica a la agricultura a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén que se ubica en la Región de Cajamarca en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 5 años a la agricultura tiene fincas de lima un aproximado de 1,5 ha de finca frutera, la cosecha lo realiza de manera semanal el cual lo vende en su caserío a los comerciantes de frutas quienes la llevan a comercializar a la ciudad de Chiclayo, además el cliente se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuanta con 05 cabezas de ganado.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en mantenimiento de sus fincas y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Remigio, 22, lives with his wife and son in Salitre, a rural, farming area in San Felipe district, which is about two hours from the city of Jaén, Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. He has been farming for five years and has a 1.5 hectare lime farm. He harvests the fruit weekly and sells it in his neighborhood to fruit merchants, who take it to the city of Chiclayo. Remigio also raises cattle, of which he has five head. He has applied for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to maintain his land so that he can continue to earn money for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his lime crop.

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en:
Mushvig is a good-natured man. He is married and has three children.
Mushvig turned to VFAC for financial support and wants a loan to purchase feed for animals. Since he was young, he helped his father in the business of animal husbandry and gained a lot of experience. Now that he has his own family, he works in animal husbandry on his own. His business allows him to meet the needs of his family. He wants to develop his business by increasing the amount of cattle. His family also helps him - his wife sells the milk from their cattle. He thanks all in advance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase feed for animals.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 36 years old, is married and has five children. She helps her husband in running their own repair shop to earn a living. Aside from this business she also has had a video-karaoke machine, with which she earns extra income. 

Susan joined GDMPC recently and has taken a loan to purchase spare parts and oil for her repair shop. She wants to be successful in her business and she wants to see her children finish their studies in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and oil for her repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase footwear to resell AND GROUNDNUTS FOR PEANUT BUTTER PROJECT

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tiene 02 hijos dependientes en el caserío La Unión de Sallique que se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de Jaén en la Región Cajamarca en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno en los caseríos cercanos a su domicilio para posteriormente llevarlos los días viernes al puerto de Chiple para vender, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio, adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con cultivo de café y maíz.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two dependent children in the small village of La Unión de Sallique, which is located in the city of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the north of Peru.  

He earns a living by raising and selling cattle. He has requested a loan of 2500 Nuevos Soles in order to buy cattle from neighboring villages and then sell them later at Chiple port on Fridays. 

Gumercindo has more than five years of experience in this business. He also farms coffee and corn.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and sale.

loans.name: Alindor Hipólito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 53 años de edad, es soltero; vive en su casa propia de material rústico herencia de su padre por un lapso de más de 40 años, en Pucará a dos horas de la cuidad e Jaén que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 25 años a la actividad de reparación de todo tipo de calzado tiene clientela fija, su taller artesanal está ubicado en su domicilio; ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para adquirir mercadería para implementar su taller y de esta manera poder tener ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 53, single, and has lived in in Pucará, in a home made of recycled materials that he inherited from his father, for over 40 years. Pucará is two hours from Jaén, in Cajamarca Region in the northern sierra of Peru.

Hipólito has for 25 years repaired all kinds of shoes. He has a workshop in his home and has a base of loyal customers. He has applied for a loan of 500 new soles to purchase tools for his workshop so that he can offer his customers better service.

loans.use: to purchase tools for a shoe repair workshop.
